so many horrible reviews  the acting was excellent all playing their roles perfectly i think the reviews were poor because of societies perceptions of love and sex and expectations of what this film represents for us as individuals and for society  for example if someone is expecting a kinky porno then they have obviously come to the wrong place       this movie has more to do with a deeply disturbed man with narcissistic tendencies as he hides his pain through power and control  in christians attempt and need to have power of ana he begins to lose himself along the way  like layers of an onion he did not even realize he had he starts to fear he is losing power over himself  all the while ana is longing for the one thing that unites us alllove  she starts to control him as a result of their mutual feelings which is something he did not expect the power of love cannot be controlled or contained in a simple contract or maintained with such strict rules  this film represents a humans most basic need love  it also shows us the longterm impact child abuse can have shaping our personalities throughout a lifetime       additionally this film is controversial in many regards sadomasochism views are different from person to person powercontrol roles etc also many do not understand sm culture  it exists  power play is real  while for most this kind of sexual experience is new and possibly difficult to understand and grasp since this lifestyle is so controversial in real life      some men and women may be offended by this film taking this movie to represent abuse in relationships which it does  although difficult to view for many because of this i believe cinema is an art form i do not condone violence to anyone ever  i look at this film just as it isa film  it is just another way for us to broaden our horizons in understanding ourselves our perceptions and the way we view life  so lets take a step back and remember that as well

another valentines day come and gone also st pattys went by in a blur i know i said i would post a review of this movie by valentines 2015 but things just got in the way maybe i just didnt want to be that guy who watches bad movies and bitches about it on the internets but the experience draws in readers just so you know i did watch fifty shades of grey on valentines day and i probably should have consumed a glass of wine or beer beforehand like fellow critic christy lemire had done fyi her review is the best    to watch fifty shades of grey is almost like a dare dare to watch a bad movie or dare to watch a movie about bondage and sadomasochism the funny thing is that such sexual acts are looked down upon and now we have a mainstream movie about the very act the majority condemn whats even more funny is that i dare to defend this movie from all the naysayers the ones who dismiss this movie because it opens the doors to the velvet underground    this movie was incredibly tame and yet people were up in arms about the whole ordeal like theyve never heard of such depravity its amazing that sex is still a touchy topic to this day and i was equally as amazed when i pointed this out back in 2006 when i reviewed the notorious bettie page see also my 2013 review of the todo list the bigger the budget the higher the controversy i guess everyone keeps overlooking the contract beween mr grey and ana and the two have to work out a mutual agreement before fucking in short its all consensual but there is that one part that seems to rub people the wrong way which i argue is almost the right response to illicit but some folk take it further by being offended    but fifty shades of grey isnt a landmark motion picture it wants to be as evident by its glossy presentation characters dressed sharp walk in sterile environments and have clean sex even if its supposed to be unusual heck even the trailer hyped this up to be way more than it should i was sold even though i scoffedit was also because of that horrible redux of beyonces otherwise brilliant crazy in love nay fifty shades of grey is a punchline it started off as a punchline a twilight fanfiction so there really is no reason to take it seriously dare to watch a bad movie this is your ticket    however i am intrigued that a mainstream movie dares to make certain sexual acts mainstream more often than not the act itself is resorted to a punchline or underlying psychological disorder or viewed in a seedy grindhouse where travis bickle and betsy are on a first date getting schooled in sexual education just think to watch fifty shades of grey back in 1975 wouldve ended a relationship maybe your date wouldve thought you were crazy you mightve even gone to jail for watching such filth    though bdsm is also viewed as unnatural by our leading lady ana or anastasia dakota johnson shes essentially the good girl trying to tame the bad boy its like that one song that goes why do good girls like bad boys she plays into mr greys sexual obsessions almost right away she says he was intimidating but was drawn to him like she made it her personal mission to find out exactly what made him tick or why he is so enamored by her    ana is rather a blank character which i noted from the first five minutes shes such a square and i suspect many audiences are particularly the ones who recoil to see mr grey playfully spank ana because she playfully bit her own lip which is against one of his rules mr grey wasnt any better except looking good for the camera he remains guarded which somewhat explains the characters shortcomings a rather interesting scene is when he actually opens up to ana but he was only able to while she was asleep the movie hints at his dark past but this entry doesnt explain it so well have to find out in the upcoming sequels    for about two hours they do more than just fuck mr grey indulges ana in the fine escapades of the high life so there are more ways these two oddlypaired consenting adults connect its painfully drawn out its sweet even if its cheesy i think the word that should be stressed is fantasy most fantasies dont take a whole lot of creativity especially when it comes to sex show a little skin play up the meek and dangerous personalities materialized by typically two attractive people maybe fifty shades of grey is more of a modern fairy tale but with fucking you go ooo and ahh and aww and then maybe gasp a few times     im sure it was all intentional to make this dark sexual world more appealing to the curious its weird sure but somewhat fascinating knowing that people keep leather whips and chains oh my and other assortments to act out their fantasies and finally heres a movie that sheds light on a topic that was placed in the special interests sections at a video store or shown on latenight cinemax there was another movie about sex lars von triers twopart epic nymphomaniac it showed here in albuquerque but only at the guild and only at night fifty shades of grey played at chain theaters that had no qualm showing it during the day yet the sex is merely a conduit for the romance set to bloom that was the other reason why this movie is fitted for mainstream    long story short fifty shades of grey was okay do what film critic christy lemire did have some wine watch the movie with some friends and giggle all the way through seriously read her review its really all you can do giggle like its the first time looking through a nudie magazine because it is and it does feel like the first mainstream movie about sex since american pie only less funny but more unintentionally funny winwin i guess    but i dunno one month later no ones really talking about fifty shades of grey i made my review to make it seem like its a landmark cultural event but its not its a punchline now everyone knows how the joke goes perhaps it overstayed its welcome like bart simpsons i didnt do it catchphrase we need something new    woozle wuzzle

boring too talkative and lacking any direction fifty shades of grey is a disappointing adaptation of the femaletargeting kin bestseller of el james surrounded by all the hype coming from the books success the movie fails to be anything more than a nicely calculated cash machine pretending to be bondage kinky romance fifty shades of grey is nothing but an impotent wannabebdsm melodrama that utterly annoys  anastasia steele dakota johnson a college graduate meets the young and ultra successful businessman christian grey jamie dornan during an interview she does for her best friend an immediate spark flies between them and from that moment el james romantic melodrama starts the beginning is intriguing and not bad at all until nothing actually happens throughout the movie overlong dialogues and lame depiction of restrained passion sam taylorjonshons delivery is far from being even partially engaging what totally ruins the movie is that the biggest asset of el james story the bdsm and kinky elements are totally softened and replace by a boring softcore scenes and completely artificial dialogues   it would definitely take some nerves to get through the final credits with little to enjoy or to appreciate fifty shades of grey is a poor delivery that could have been a major improvement of its source material if it had been naughtier and kinkier

if there is one thing fifty shades of grey proves its that hollywood has no interest in catering to the female gaze  even when making a film that is supposed to be a female erotic fantasy ignoring the issues that exist with the story and the misrepresentation of sm practices this is a film that refuses to accept what it is all the sex scenes which are devoid of anything resembling titillation focus almost exclusively on the body of dakota johnson even with a female team behind the camera the heterosexual male gaze cannot be quashed when in comes of jamie dornan the film is down right prudish we get to see almost nothing of his physique with the camera quickly shying away from even a brief glimpse of his bare ass no such reservations exist where johnson is concerned we get to see her naked in all her glory being restrained and whipped even if both are too tamed to shock or titillate fifty shades of grey shows a fundamental misunderstanding of heterosexual female desire which is made more problematic with a target audience of straight women and on behind the camera maybe its because everyone knows this is the epitome of trash and they are just collecting a paycheck dornan in particular looks like hes sucking on a lemon the whole film and is only there because the producers have some solid blackmail material on him dakota johnson is the only one who manages to escape the energy sucking mess she takes the mess in stride realizing fifty shades for what it is a chance to make a lot of money and get herself noticed she delivers lines that make george lucas look like a great writer of romance like shes in on the joke she knows shes making trash and shes going to have fun with it johnsons efforts cant make fifty shades good there is no power on earth that can manage that feat but she does make it bearable even when she is reduced to writhing around restrained and naked

it wasnt terrible i had read the first couple pages of the book and found the writing to be insufferable but i also fully expected the screenplay to iron out the kinks heh like with the twilight movies which had better material to work with in comparison anastasia is still a little unnecessarily inept and vapid at first and dakota johnson oversells her mousiness but she proves herself a subtle comedienne in the hardware store and drunken voicemail scenes    jamie dornan is sufficiently sexy and tortured and predatory but the script is careful to make sure anas free will is at the forefront of every decision though some may argue its the illusion of freedom because shes so inexperienced and hes so persistent even so that doesnt make her decisions any less her own nor his lust any less an earnest desire for connection in the only depraved way he knows how its a problematic relationship dynamic to be sure and theres really only one harlequin fantasy way to end it but so far the representation seems unmannered and unfettered heh

curious thats got to be the most apt publicity tagline for a me for a movie ever its not that i was curious about the content per say i was curious as to what the fuss was all about why are so many people so rabidly into this story i had to know no way on earth would this ever be my kind of movie but a phenomenon this big is hard for me to ignore plus i had a coupon    i dont need to explain the very thin plot to you do i no okay moving on ill admit there was a lot that fascinated and intrigued me about this film it raised many questions about relationship roles as well as trust and expectations a lot of it had me really thinking in a way that stuck with me most of the rest of the day let me set things straight i was pondering things not fantasizing philosphically different what part of their relationship was okay vs what should have been a red flag to send anastasia running out the door what would i be willing to put up with vs whats going too far    because for such a highly coveted romance they really dont have a lot of substance there like any other movie relationship the two inexplicably fall desperately in love immediately they cant even bear to go a couple hours from each other gag and for someone who claimed to be so devoted to his girl mr grey really does put a lot of unfair and arguably abusive and manipulative pressure on her those are the sorts of things i was thinking about    as far as the kink its my understanding that its not a very accurate representation of the culture ive been told that it should be based on trust and that the open honesty and communication necessary to make it work make for a very solid relationship that was not here whatsoever would i ever wanna read the book umm no besides the fact that its amateurishly written i feel if i really wanted to know about such things thered be much better sources still though id rather reread lotr    im coming off pretty negative there was some fun to it yes jamie dornan was incredibly hot and while dakota johnson is a little green as an actress she did have a likability its my understanding that the screenplay smartened things up a bit although much came off as very dumb without having read it though i could always tell when a line of dialogue must have been taken verbatum from the source it was usually the really silly sounding lines that were meant to be sexy often delivered in a fairly deadpan manner inappropriate giggles broke out in the audience it was a fun fantasy to escape to as long as you didnt pay too much attention to the details    would i see it again not any time soon a couple days after i was at the movies with a friend our intended flick was cancelled due to a leaky roof in the auditorium her first suggestion would you see fifty shades again no i resounded quite forcefully we saw imitation game instead much better choice    fifty shades of grey  m m m

i might have been previously too harsh on the fifty shades film when i reviewed it before its still definitely not anything exciting to watch but compared to the book it actually is better    when making a film based on a terrible book series you already dont have much to work with especially when the books author constantly hounds harasses and pesters the director into giving her as much creative control as she can possibly have if it werent for e l james being a harpy on set this film actually might have had even more intelligence associated with it as it stands its already better than the novel of course a piece of shit cake is better than the novel but think of how much better it would be if the terrible author of the book wasnt affiliated with its production    there were i admit creative changes made in the script that never happen in the book that would have made the story poignant a word james doesnt understand and never can understand    i hated the fifty shades novel with every fiber of my being its romanticized abuse and the protagonist is highly unlikable in the film however she has a personality that her blank slate counterpart in the book doesnt she has a bit more fire and a bit more strength not too much but more its like the producers of the film knew that the book was terrible and wanted to turn it into something beautiful thats never easy to do and i have to admit that i feel sympathy for them when having to deal with the books author hounding them the entire time picking apart every little thing and demanding things be added or be removed or changed    im less fascinated with the film itself than i am with what the film could have been without e l james influence she needs to realize that there just are more creative people than her and to allow some breathing room her books are boring painfully boring but the movies have a chance to turn that possibility of saucy narcandsupply relationship into something engaging enthralling and fun    i know that james will remain glued to people on the next film as well i can only pray that they dont allow her to dog them around in the same manner christian proudly does in her awful books

fifty shades of grey review by mike smith     literature student anastasia steeles life changes forever when she meets handsome yet tormented billionaire christian grey     when i write a review i try to find at least one good thing about every movie that being said fifty shades of grey had nothing to contribute to my cinematic love the cast is terrible dakota johnson and jamie dornan have no on screen chemistry they dont keep us interested in the film because they cant act at one point charlie hunnam was attached to play the main role of christian gray and after wasting a hour and fifty minutes on this abortion i really think he would have brought some acting to this train wreck the writing is crap and christian gray came off more like a stalker and a creeper anastasia steele seems like she is slow and dumb one thing that pisses me off about this movie is that if christian gray was just an average guy not a billionaire the tone of the movie would be completely different the music is just dark ominous tones or crappy covers of songs      and lets not forget the sex scenes there is nothing special about any of it so what you see her boobs not a big deal but the sex parts which is what the books are built upon are nothing to be excited about i should have just watched a real porno there would have been a better story and much better acting it makes me cringe knowing there are two more movies coming soon cheers and remember i watch the crappy movies so you dont have too     05 out of 10             edited by samantha locke

i have actually read the book and i hated it it felt incredibly unrealistic which might be the point but it kind of felt like the author thought that in order to write an erotic novel she has to make up a fictional character as screwed up and twisted as christian grey the book would have been a lot better and believable if it had been a romantic love story only sexier it can actually be romantic and erotic at the same time it doesnt have to be the one or the other because when the story is created the way that it is i dont really believe in the characters why would anastasia steele a 22yearold inexperienced literature student fall in love with a guy like christian grey  with that said i enjoyed the movie better than the book for some reason the storyline felt a slightly bit more plausible on screen although i still stand by my opinion that the character of christian grey isnt very credible   i was actually a bit afraid that they were going to romanticize this movie a bit too much i was happily surprised of how much they actually managed to show because seeing as the book has become an absolute sensation by now and most of the people who go to see the movie have probably read the book it wouldnt have worked to romanticize it and im happy that it managed to be so true to the book without it getting too much

i had to see this movie to see what all the hype was about my daughter and i went to see it on a weekday afternoon so the theater was empty except for us and a couple so i cant tell whether the audience appreciated it or not my daughter had read the books and let me know the writing was somewhat juvenile so not to expect too much from that area that advice turned out to be very good advice and i had to focus on suspending my disbelief to get down under the terrible writing and get to the meat of the story as it were i enjoyed this movie because of its unconventional story there are not a lot of movies out there strictly for adults these days the pg 13 rating has been given to a big portion of the industry to bring in the tween audiences and their money i was not convinced that jamie dornan was right for playing the part of grey but it turned out that he did a good job the chemistry could have been better between the two leading actors but i got the idea she was somewhat reluctant to get involved with the guy in the first place it was an enjoyable time spent in the theater i was entertained and that is what i pay for at the ticket booth

sam taylorjohnsons film of el jamess twilight fan fictionturnedphenomenon is dreadful to be laughable nor so brilliant to be powerful  instead they get a sparky first third a rote obsessive love story anodyne kinkiness contentious sexual politics slivers of skillful filmmaking and a promising turn from dakota johnson daughter of actress melanie griffiths and actor don johnson  the setup is a simple one bookish anastasia steele johnson meets christian grey jamie dornan a business tycoon hiding a troubled past a lust for bdsm and a penchant for playing really miserable tunes on the piano he lavishes his wealth on her hoping shell sign a contract to become his submissive she yearns for a more typical movieandadinnertype relationship but tests her hard and soft limits anyway  as the emotions get more intense and we begin to learn the motivations underpinning greys need for dominance the film gets bogged down in repetitive earnest romantic drama  dornan as grey is no hero and johnson was so understated it was like she wasnt even there at all she gives anastasia both a strength and sense of humour

likes of beyonce sia and ellie goulding make the sex scenes look more like old music videos theres no grit just gloss the movie shies away from real dirty details like bodily fluids and bruises save for a quick peek at christians junk as he spanks ana    fifty shades of grey is porn for tweens and a piss poor substitute for the books darker bloodier instincts the tampon scene is missing too bad heres what i think this movie is a female fantasy and it is all from the womans point of view therefore the female character makes sense but the male character is all over the place his actions and motivations dont make any sense except as a foil for her the title suggests that the writer might even be somewhat aware of what shes doing  a character with 50 shades should be one with so many variations that he is inscrutable unfortunately rather than being multifaceted and mysterious mr grey comes off as a muddle of conflicting cliches   if the story could be taken seriously at all perhaps it is as a study of the contemporary womans fantasy of the ideal man according to this movie he is rich good looking young driven persistent superficially dangerous but soft on the inside ubersuccessful but not too bright and totally malleable to a woman who knows what she wants and is willing to stand up for herself  there really should be a scene at the end where she wakes up and realizes that she has fallen off a ladder at the hardware store and bumped her head

this is a wonderful movie for anyone studying psychology admittedly i had no interest in reading the book or joining in on the hype surrounding it it is my opinion that this movie truly explores the character of mr grey and not his counterpart ana although anas life is more fully explored in the movie and her character is the one audiences are lead to be able to relate with i do not believe she is as important as mr grey   a boy neglected by a drug addicted mother adopted by a wealthy family that also neglects him sexually abused by a family friend and ultimately the circle of abuse continues as he himself becomes the abuser this is a story about a man that begins to overcome the emotional obstacles that his past has caused and the woman he idolizes for her innocence   true love is the ability to accept someone regardless of their flaws i have been in many relationships in which i have made compromises for the one i loved i am in no way condoning abuse there is a distinction between abuse and sadism which ana was unable to comprehend   ultimately to truly understand this movie you must look beyond the surface as is true with everything in life

fifty shades of grey is that rare experience that leaves you angry as it has insulted my intelligence and my attention  i dont even know where to begin  the cast try their hardest to make it past a worthless script and laughibly awful dialogue  its involves anastatia steele a young woman who interviews billionare christian grey  the two become quickly attracted to each other and she is pulled into his lavish world but she soon discovers he has a dark secret  dakota johnson plays anastatia and jamie dornan plays christian  these two have little to no chemsitry on screen with johnson feeling like a young child against dornans creepy and completely serious performance  a little humor could have done the characters some good since the complete lack of any fun between them made their romance as boring as it comes  this is a film that was made strictly because of the success of the book which most would agree is porn for soccer moms  it was not a well recieved book so i never imagined the film would be any better but i gave it the benefit of the doubt nonetheless  but this erotic twilight ripoff simply doesnt do anything interesting for nearly two hours and gives us a joyless and strange romance with actors with absolutely no chemistry  to call this film an expensive porno would be accurate as the story here is about as intersting as a porno  fifty shades of grey will certainly become a series but it will clearly be made out of greed and not quality

fifty shades of i cant believe i watched this twice i read the trilogy  not because im into the romance genre im a love of the classics and yes ive actually read tess of the durbervilles but because a ridiculous number of my married and single lady friends read them and well curiosity got the better of me we all know how terribly el james writes and the subject matter leaves a lot to be desired plus weve pretty much heard enough criticism about the unrealistic nature of the christiananastasia bdsm relationship we dont need to rehash the domestic violence discussions     lets talk about some of the merits of the movie    so we have one young woman about to graduate from college who finds herself reluctantly interviewing the worlds most eligible bachelor under thirty hes smitten almost immediately and shes intrigued but intimidated the deadly hot billionaire decides to engage in what could easily be defined as moderately stalkerish behavior meant to entice the young woman into a dominantsubmissive relationship guy engages in some fairly elaborate stunts to get girls attention including showering her with gifts even though he claims adamantly that hes not the hearts and flowers kind of guy no instead he sends first editions of thomas hardy novels a new apple laptop and an audi coupe we should all be so lucky and though this guy wants to be in control dominating every part of the girls life it becomes very clear by the end that this isnt the case at all she finally decides she cant take the red room his need to punish her or his inability to give her more so she bolts and leaves him completely bewildered    lets talk anastasia and christian from a young adult perspective its hard to give yourself completely to someone else when youre not entirely sure who you are and have little life experience to rely upon christian has not exactly had the most traditional of upbringings in the first novelmovie we know he was adopted by the very wealthy and successful greys that his biological mother was probably on child protective services frequent flier and that he lost his virginity to one of his mothers friends at the age of fifteen hes lived a full life at the age of 27 and is hesitant to let anyone really know him or touch him anastasia is completely different she meets christian and he believes somewhat mistakenly that she would be the perfect submissive based on his first impression ana is anything but submissive     its a welcome change in the screen adaptation typically screen adaptations pale in comparison to their literary counterparts with a few notable exceptions this is the first time ive read a book and been more pleased with the movie kelly marcel omits a lot of anas tiresome inner monologue and indecisiveness in favor of a slightly more assertive and concerned female character unlike the book ana asks a lot of christian and finds a way to pull him out of his comfort zone and into hers for a person who professes to exude control in all matters christian loses himself fairly quickly in his pursuit of ana what we end up seeing is a power struggle between two truly dominant people looking for the right opportunity to submit to someone christian speaks often of trust and comfort in submission he ultimately has to trust her as much as she has to trust him in order for their relationship to continue     the biggest point of controversy is christians treatment of anastasia he is constantly aware of her location inserts himself into her life in overbearing and creepy ways and tries to direct her life fortunately for everyone anastasia is relatively astute and keeps a sense of humor and propriety about the situation often poking fun at christian for his behavior there are points where being sexually adventurous borders on overtly sadistic actions that make us uncomfortable particularly towards the end ana questions this too even going as far as to ask why do you want to punish me she asks in a way that most of us vanilla types are asking too what is it that drives people to bdsm where christian is concerned we dont get the answers until later in the trilogy but were also wondering why exactly he is so obsessed with ana is it love when she admits her feelings for him christian acts completely astonished that anyone could be in love with him given his sexual perversions and generally screwed up mental state honestly being in love in your early twenties is a lot like that  two complete head cases coming together to make some sort of sense in the world honestly who are we really to judge theres something to be said for romanticizing these kinds of relationships that border on abuse but you really could cite how frequently they exist in films and literature  tess of the durbervilles is a fantastic example besides the erotic mommy porn reputation the novel and film have garnered maybe people actually relate in some way to the material its not just escapism but something else     other points there was a startling lack of development of the other central characters from the novel in a trilogy you have a little more time to waste i suppose the chemistry between jamie dornan and dakota johnson is initially shaky but works itself out a bit by the end sam taylorjohnson actually did a really fantastic job of directing a film that arguably had a lot of high expectations from the outset its unfortunate she wont be around for the sequels the sex scenes were in my opinion relatively tasteful and not exploitative i saw more of dakota johnson than i needed to although jamie dornan did look fantastic in those infamous distressed jeans oy     bottom line i saw it with girlfriends in the theater the first time and watched in on bluray alone the second time i was entertained and sometimes thats whats really important

maybe its because expectations were so low maybe its because it was released at the same time as jupiter ascending but dons body armour cuts lights this isnt nearly as terrible as its reputation would suggest      on the surface its actually kind of adequate  sam taylorwoods direction is for the most part network tv drama standard but its really whats needed for a tale like this  she does kind of choke towards the end not yet up to the task of using the codes of cinema to show progression in the third important scene set in the same room with the same characters but shes also smart enough to bring some intentional laughs to the early scenes that undercut the general unlikelihood of the setup  jamie dornan blunders his way through role that hes somewhat miscast is whereas dakota johnson defies expectations and carries herself reasonably well  the script starts totting up the logical inconsistencies in scene one and doesnt let up a college newspaper scores an interview with a billionaire industrialist and lets the assigned journalist chuck a sickie and send her flatmate how small is their journalism programme but its not so much offensive as lazy  and assumes the audience is lazy  and is probably right    for all the furore and handwringing over the films supposed misogyny theres really not a lot to support it  this is the story of a naÃ¯ve young woman who flirts with the possibility of an unfulfilling and onesided relationship spoiler before growing to a point where she not only walks out but gains the upper hand  if this were a thriller instead of a romantic drama and she cut his balls off instead of walking out itd be hailed as a trashy feminist triumph  yes the film exaggerates anastasias stupidity in the early scenes not because it is misogynist but because it is a hollywood film and its drawn in broad strokes  the women in pygmalion stories are styled to be unrealistically dowdy and anastasia is styled to be unrealistically dumb because it gives her room to grow  outside the central pairing virtually every character in this film who says or does anything is female  it passes the bechdel test with flying colours insert your own grey joke  possibly the closest it comes to real womanhating behaviour is in casting academy award winner marcia gay harden as the mum  if you honestly think this film deserves to be singled out for its treatment of women youve had the pleasure of missing an awful lot of hollywoods output for the past couple of decades    the films portrayal of bdsm and the people who practise it is kind of rubbish its poorly researched and it relies heavily on the naivety of the mainstream audience  that said any offensiveness relies heavily on the fact that in portraying a subject rarely touched on by mainstream film or even in indie film that follows a traditional narrative theres certain to be an extent to which it is taken to be the story of whips  chains romance rather than a story  yes the film centres on a character whose interest in bdsm is suggested to be closely aligned to negative stereotypes of alternative sexuality past abuse and emotional unavailability  but these intimations come principally from other characters  who share the same preconceptions and prejudices as folk in the real world  to criticise the film for taking a negative stance on bdsm is to criticise the characters for their inability to accurately pathologise themselves  if anything it meets the kink community halfway by its declamation that dominance is no excuse for abusiveness and shant be taken as such    is it any good  no not really but benignly rather than offensively so  theres no point rushing out to see it because theres nothing to get excited about but if you saw either of the leads on the poster and thought i could stand to watch something that features that persons arse prominently and its offered on your streaming service of choice half price one day and youve got an enormous pile of ironing or something to do then you could actually do worse

i guess its always hard to make a good film from a highly popular book particularly when the book in questions main selling point was making curiosity about sadomasochistic sexual relationships trendy and mainstream   i can read a book and talk about sm stuff and not feel a weirdo     plus the fact that the movie failed in its prime objective to get some real chemistry between the lead actor and actress well actually i suspect that  the prime reason for making the movie was to make money and it  kinda showed  the male lead had a hard job  he was supposed to be a dominant but actually showed classic submissive behaviour throughout the film  it would appear that the filmmakers were a little sketchy on the nature of sm  topbottom relationships  i cant imagine  although i clearly dont speak for women were much attracted to mr grey however much they might have wanted to be anastasia  steel  also showed a rather transparent lack of pull towards mr grey her best moments were when he took her for a spin in his glider   so a poor to average datemovie where the chap is attractive because hes richi think its been done a thousand times before and often better    mind i was very jealous of the redroom and all the beautiful equipment in it       and miss steele did have a nice bottom

sam taylorjohnsons character driven erotic romance drama thriller falls flat just ten minutes into the movie the picture has a lot of issues when one is dealing with a drama involving characters or in other words a character driven picture the emphasis all the way should go to how the characters are written  shown and performedthe first major problem which marred the whole narrative was the ludicrously boring and badly written screenplay by the four writers not only are the characters poorly written but also poorly developed throughout the length and breadth of the film and as a consequence it does drags and takes the venom of the plot revolving around the charactersa film which possess erotic romantic scenes must and should be well shown and there is where the direction falls apart none of the romantic scenes throughout the picture have any sense of purpose or moments or even evocative imagery in either direction even thought the scenes are well lit and the plot basically rests on the imagery of the scenes  they just fall flat and redundant as the contract written sam johnson also fails to bring out something special of a terrible screenplay and also the actors now the actors themselves are not bad in portraying what they are told to portray even though they are no way near the potential the lead characters are such one dimensional in nature that nothing interesting can be pulled out of the hat  so the plot was ultimately and constantly reminded to us in form of sms texts and email replies  those were probably the only understanding of the nature of the leads so the whole process of collaboration from the script to the director to the actor stumbled within the first couple of minutes and hence the result is a pretty much the synopsis of the picture from a cinematography point of view  i wouldnt say it was bad on the contrary from a technical side i thought the setting was nicely lit and atmospheric bringing some tension to the otherwise dull storytelling there were also nice use of colors seamus mcgarvey can hold his head high another tool that could have been nicely used was the score which again lacked any sort of purpose in enhancing the picture it was thrown into it to make it sound nice there is no artistry shown by the director in any department which could have enhanced the characters a little bit more than what was written having said all these and well most of them are negative i would like to say the premise of the source material was probably not the best and certainly the casting was too much for non exceptional actors to handle so a potentially bad premise turned into a preposterous screenplay probably shouldnt have made the theaters at all and could have gone straight to video

despite lead actress dakota johnsons best efforts to salvage the material which are certainly appreciated and some moments of trashy entertainment fifty shades of grey is a bad movie plain and simple the script while better written than the book not like thats hard but still is still blunt obvious and filled with groanworthy dialogue the talented johnson is saddled with the wooden and stiff and i dont just mean down there jamie dornan as her costar leaving her to desperately grasp for any semblance of screen chemistry the movie may periodically flirt with the direction is handsome yet lacking much real style or personality the plot keeps repetitively dragging along in circles like a bdsmcurious dog chasing its own tail and the titular sex scenes are underwhelming and tame trying too hard to class up and make hollywoodfriendly what should be trashy and shameless top that off with one of the most frustrating and anticlimactic movie endings in recent memory and im left feeling uncertain as to how anyone could be satisfied enough to hunger for the inevitable sequels

oh who cares about the synopsis im sure it has been done to death by now gosh i was so ashamed about watching this film and for the first hour i confessed so to my husband i was kind of ashamed about liking this film well not like more not hate   actually its quite an interesting love story for the most part yes it is hokey writing the whole shadow of el james insisting on final cut is all over it it is inconceivably bollocks about the bdms scene considering the bdsm theme it is remarkably vanilla being a film about female sexuality there is a lot more tits and fanny than there is male nudity i mean not one full frontal really queen however i believe the major fault in this film is jamie dornan in all his press junkits he came across as quite clueless and wow does he not sell the dominant here zero chemistry with dakota johnson and just doesnt really look suited scuse the pun to the part i think christian grey needs a more hugh jackman stature about him not read the books but it would seem that he needed to be more of a presence    anyway i did enjoy dakota johnson a lot she completely sold her character and was a joy to behold it is shot really beautifully nice not to obvious grey wash to everything   fortunately for me the film takes a nose dive into the dung heap in the last half the do your worst is ridiculously vanilla and it is all just rather a bit craptastic its like el james took over and though sam taylor johnson was being a bit too good and showing her up pretty awful really   the fault for me lies with jamess final say and dornans horrible acting you wont go to hell for catching this on a plane i heard thoughts saying that this would have been better if it was worse but i think that if the director had been given free rein and christian grey had been better cast this could have actually been quite a compelling film what a fucking shame it really isnt

look this isnt going to be a review that raves about how good this film is because it truly is trash i feel as though this film is a genius picture on many levels due to its manipulative styles and ways of getting people into the theatre looking back on fifty shades of grey it really was just a marketing tactic for a certain demographic sure fans of the book watched it and may have got some enjoyment out of it but the story accompanied by the godawful dialogue really does make this film a treat to watch even if you can admit how bad it is i have no idea how seriously the books are to be taken nor do i ever intend on finding that out but this film is an absolute blast to watch because the dialogue is completely ridiculous here is why you should check out fifty shades of grey even though its terrible    following anastasia steele and christian grey as they meet through a business meeting she quickly becomes infatuated with him only to realize that there is a lot more to him behind the scenes tormented by the fact that he likes to inflict pain onto women who enjoy it he is very heavy into bdsm accepting her as his girlfriend and trying to get her to sign a nondisclosure agreement to participate in these events that would pleasure him their relationship grows in very strange ways filled with horribly written dialogue and a plot that really doesnt go anywhere this first instalment doesnt do to get fans to return although im sure the readers will be there on day one of all three films    while the story of this film is obviously not to be taken too seriously the performances in both dakota johnson and jamie dornan definitely lifts the film from the ashes in my opinion there chemistry may not be perfect but they do give these roles their all especially johnson these are some of the most irrelevant and dumb characters i have seen onscreen in quite some time but their performances are what make them bearable there are times when the dialogue coming out of their mouths is so terrible that i can do nothing but chuckle but anastasia could be completely in tears there was clear effort in making this film better than it    the main reason people flocked out to see this film was clearly due to the shock value people who hadnt read the books were curious people who knew it was going to be a poor film wanted a good laugh and fans of the book were hoping to be satisfied but were the scenes memorable in any way memorable in the sense that they are solely done for shock value yes but they really arent that shocking especially when they are limited even said all of this these sequences should please fans of the book in that way i guess the film does its job    in the end fifty shades of grey sets out to please the fans and draw in interested people that is exactly what it accomplished and absolutely nothing more with wooden characters and a plot that centres solely around the fact that a woman is unsure if she should be trusting this man there really isnt much substance to be had overall as i said it does its core job for fans but newcomers will either roll their eyes find it funny or walk out released on valentines day as are the sequels even at the height of its popularity especially when the 1st edition came out i just knew hollywood would not keep their hands of this one no matter how ridiculous the whole concept is i guess this is where i should admit that i havent read the book so this review wont be comparing the two or complaining about what the movie did or didnt do from the book no this review is just going to be based around the actual movie and for the life of me i cant see what all the hype is about this el james erotic best seller was actually conceived as a twilight fan story i cant even begin to imagine the level of atrocity that would have given birth to if the idea was picked up in the original over hyped mediocre twilight series anyways lets gets to the plot the story follows anastasia steele dakota johnson a depressingly ordinary college girl who goes through life without many close friends outside her roommate leads an existence of convention and routine this changes when her roommate asks her to interview christian grey jamie dornan an elusive single billionaire whos consistent protection of his private life has warranted great question from the moment she sees him anastasia is smitten with everything about him because he is everything she isnt bold confident unafraid and suave one can tell just from the way christian looks and speaks to anastasia having great patience and acceptance with her that he admires her for her own traits as well shes simple frightened vulnerable and just the kind of girl hes looking for the two quietly hit it off with christian requesting simple things like coffee outings and simple hangouts before going through one of his many periods of being standoffish and confusing to anastasia eventually he reveals his motives hes looking for a sexual relationship with no commitments and no conventionality in terms of going on dates he wants sex and he wants it his way proposing a contract to anastasia in hopes she will become the submissive to his dominant in which shell stay at his spacious penthouse on weekends to engage in wild sexual escapades yup this is the plot of an actual movie not your usual porn production from digital playground or naughty america people actually invested in this movie there are all sorts of major issues with the film we can start with the laughable screenplay which would have been rejected by the lifetime channel and in fact im going to guess that it would have been rejected has a fiveyearold written it the dialogue is without question some of the most laughable ive heard in a very long time in fact the movie seems to be lost in what decade it is because there are times that the f word is used and its used in a way to where its supposed to be shocking really its going to take more than that the entire character development between the two lead characters is another joke and after a while you really cant buy into any of the melodrama and youve just got to sit back and laugh yet another problem is that the film just isnt erotic films like fatal attraction basic instinct 8mm are just a few examples that qualify as erotic films a lot of the lack of eroticness has to be blamed on the director who just seems to have been the wrong fit for the material nothing from the erotic nature to the serious stuff works and everything is poorly edited dakota johnson and jamie dornan fit their roles pretty well they are good looking  awkward i guess thats how they are supposed to be however the two completely lack any kind of chemistry together like i mentioned above the plot was originally meant to be twiligth fan fiction we cant help but notice the similarities between the lead protagonists in comparison to the very boring edward  bella maybe thats intentional again alluding to greys refusal to make this a relationship of any conventionality but its difficult to get wrapped up in the sex scenes when both parties seem disinterested in one another and bored furthermore the acting of the two leads varies from acceptable to incredibly poor and contrived on the whole fifty shades of grey may go down as one of the most poorlywritten films of the film year in terms of having singular lines of dialog that are capable of producing unintentional laughs and sneers  combine the elements of bad dialog with unremarkable sex scenes and an an overall idiotic portrayal of a sex subculture and you have a film that flatlines where it should have stunned  entertained just as mr gray had said this is fifty shades of fd up

the plot is something a teenager could come up with dull and predictable and the entire film hinges on a few erotic scenes that other films have done far better     no matter how they spin it the two main characters need serious therapy for their deep seeded erotic urges that the film tries to pass off as something wholesome

first of all i want to say i am a guy and i liked 50 shades of grey  i also minored in psychology in college i tend to find anything that deals with understanding the human condition fascinating i wonder why i  chose trying to understand computers as a career path over people this movie is categorised as a romance but it is a torrid sort i actually liked 50 shades of grey but not for the reasons as how its marketed but for the psychological depth of the two main characters the movie is still running so i will refrain from going into too much detail     the movie is not about sex anyone who comes out of the theatre feeling they got their jollies off seeing some soft porn might be some sick motherfrs the movie is about 2 things abuse of power in relationships and the effects of child abuse  i felt uncomfortable thru the whole movie everything the male protagonist irked me he displayed the same qualities of a psychopath if he wasnt such a philanthropist and oh a billionaire of his own company and apparently the only eligible guy in the city this movie would have more resembled a movie about a stalker on the prowl     but the story is much more than some messed up guy who expresses himself awkwardly through bdsm it is about someone who tries to deal with his own inner issues as a result of suffering abuse in his own childhood through no fault of his own i should add the female protagonist has a face as sweet as an angel but i suspect it will be revealed she has her own personal battles to deal with as well i suspect hers might be on par with christian grey why else would she subject herself to the fd up situation she cant get out of then again we all find ourselves in situations we cant get out of maybe the real moral of the story should be to steer clear of domineering partners and find your equal now i have not read the books nor plan to but i hear there are already sequels in the works to flesh out the rest of the issues these two are going to deal with     this movie is fascinating because it tackles real psychological issues child abuse has a way of manifesting in destructive ways in adulthood i couldnt decide if actor jamie dornan was supposed to intentionally act stilted throughout the movie because of the trauma i certainly did not see the attraction at all hes more of a show off than a person of magnetic gravitas dakota johnson sold me completely and her acting was believable look past the sex the bondage the skin on skin because these are really not the focus     the author hooked us with rope and have now forced us you and me to feel the pain of the main characters a woman emotionally trapped to a real fd up guy and a guy who shouldve gotten therapy unfortunately we are the submissive and they are our dominant why did the author choose bdsm to tell a romancein the world of bdsm it is a negotiation of pain and pleasure appropriation between dominant and submissive whereas in a rape situation there is no negotiation between victim and victimiser no wonder i felt that uneasy feeling throughout the whole movie

love it or hate the idea fifty shades of grey is one of the biggest film releases this year strategically placed on a valentines day weekend release the millions and millions of woman who were captivated by the highly successful novel series were lining up around the block to get their first taste of a live action mr grey     fifty shades of grey is basically twilights replacement funnily enough stemming from twilight fan fiction fifty shades follows an awkward young woman who is pursued by an improbable love interest the main difference being that instead of edwards vampirism mr grey sports a bdsm fetish where he must dominate his sexual partner and this was the big draw card to the novel its explicit sex scenes but how would this translate to a modern major motion picture many people were shocked to find the film was rated ma rather than a hard r well i found that the sex scenes were quite tastefully shot and the two leads bonded well together here but i really thought it was going to go a whole lot further the domination scenes were pretty tame i expected it to get pretty brutal but i suppose we gotta leave some room for build up in the sequels     i thought the sexual tension between anastasia and mr grey was great for the most part but then jamie dornan mr grey would do something stupid like bite a piece of toast that anastasia is holding or give a hollow line delivery that just broke any sense of coolness that this character had in fact it is dornans performance that ultimately harms this film he is almost good but on the contrary  dakota johnson who plays anastasia is great as the girl next door type a lot of people seem to have a problem with her but i felt that she played the role strongly and i believed her the whole way     i didnt love this film it is lame lovey dovey and cheesy but thats what i expected it is an interesting enough story that had me for most of the way it does run a tad long though and i wasnt digging the ending much but im sure it will be remedied in the inevitable sequel if you have even the slightest interest in this film you need to go see it in cinemas     35    behind this door is my playroom  mr grey  what like where you keep your xbox and stuff  anastasia

by ricky miller       fifty shades of grey   much ado about nothing    fifty shades of grey is an is an overblown melodrama that is on par with director paul verhoevens showgirls for degree of awfulness  dakota johnson tvs ben and kate is the naÃ£Ã£Ã¢ve young girl who gets seduced into the world of masochist christian grey jamie dornan marie antoinette      going back to the  days of my youth i actually read the books before   i saw the movie i did this with stephen kings misery and tom clancys the hunt for red october      both were great movies but the reason rested in the directors hands  the reason both of the movies were so good rested in the resulting flicks done by rob reiner and john mctiernan  reiner steered kathy bates to an oscar win for misery while mctiernan introduced a star in the making with alec baldwin             nowadays i think the movie should stand alone without having read the book             with this in mind i did not resort to reading the pages of el jamess  page turners   both screenwriters james who also penned the novel its based on  and kelly marcel add nothing of any merit to the superficial and trite dialogue            another predicament with fifty shades is one does not care in the very least about these selfish lovebirds  sure it might have been steamy and tantalizing on the page but director sam taylorjohnson never pulls one into the proceedings and their earthquaking romance  dornans selfish persona of christian grey is just that of a spoiled yahoo who does not really care for others but just his own gluttonous selfish appetite  johnsons anastasia steele is seduced by grey and all his shortcomings               adding to the credibility of the movie is the appearance of oscarwinner marcia gay harden as christians psychologist mom dr grace travelyan grey  her appearance although brief shows how unimportant christian is to the very scheme of things in real life  her persona is not one of ignorance but of a person who is just prone to look the other way    looking back at socalled controversial movies of my youth like 9 12 weeks zalman kings two moon junction and wild orchid i think of how ludicrous it was to deem these movies controversial  they are just bloody movies and nothing more  controversy aside i just want to see a good movie paul thomas andersons boogie nights was one of the better movies i have seen in the past 20 years  the same goes for michael manns copsandrobbers tale heat wherein an aged robert deniro and al pacino square off in a pretzeltwisting suspense actionthriller   that is what i want in my movie  quality  its not asking for much but that is what i want to spend my money on   fifty shades of grey for all intents and purposes is a complete waste of time  johnsons  anastasia is a woman who realizes all too late that there is more to life than the simple pleasure of appealing to ones loins  real life is far too important  grade  c

big als movie review  fifty shades of grey    college student anastasia steele is introduced into the bdsm lifestyle after a chance meeting with christian grey a billionaire businessman with a twisted past     this film was a laughable mistake     to be fair the novel that its based on is just guiltypleasure fun filled with the old goodgirlsaveschangesbroodingbutbeautifulbillionairebadboy fantasy but what a readers minds eye will forgive from a subpar novel a movie audience members real eyes and ears will not sure the script was weak the miscasted actors couldnt act and the much anticipated sex scenes seemed tame but i mean at least the soundtrack was decent     grade  d    big al says fifty shades of grey is a renterbut only if you want to hatewatch

as seen on castle rock news by deke the movie geek    whos it for fans of cheesy romance novels the marquis de sade the lifetime network movies so bad they make you laugh out loud at times unintended by the filmmakers to be funny much to the horror of fellow moviegoers    50 shades of grey is based upon an el james novel that actually does hit upon some deep human issues  though unfortunately it does not have the ability to penetrate beneath some of the complexities it scratches upon at the core of the film is the deep human desire to compensate for deep physical emotional and mental trauma the protagonists delve into the world of sadomasochism because that represents to mr grey a device of controlling his environment and the response of others especially the one he allows to be closest to him    there is essentially a great deal of disappointment in a human attempting to micromanage their world and those around him a great fail in the area of relating to another this leads to the conclusion that in our mutual yearning for fellowship and intimacy that no amount of deviancy could ever satisfy or fulfill anyone its too bad this potentially great topic was put in the hands of filmmakers that chose to focus on sensationalism of sensuality    it is funny that the film shot in an ironic 9  12 weeks and it shows that the cast took only 5 days to learn their dialogue the movie has also been banned in kenya for moral reasons and perhaps should have been in the united states for artistic reasons ironically the seahawks won their first super bowl during filming but the choices made by the filmmakers amounted cinematically to not handing off to marshawn lynch in the last superbowl a bad call to make this film on their part the film has enjoyed the commercial success of its shallow fluffy book franchise its based upon thus we can sadly expect more of the same in future poorly made cinema lacking any real substance

sam taylorjohnsons adaptation of fifty shades of grey puts emphasis on the grey  the color grey as in bland    for a 2 hour story surrounding kinky sex there is very little in the way of arousing excitement  the story is thin and it never seems to be heading in a forward direction  integral plot details are far and few in between leaving the sex to stand out    on the subject of sex there are a number of erotic scenes with a bunch of buildup for them  to associate with the rrating these scenes never fully engulf what makes the fifty shades of grey what its meant to be  possible pushing to the nc17 rating is what is needed    dakota johnson and jamie dornan are attractive in their own right but viewing their performances is very tiring  maybe the characters are meant to be this way but its easier to read then view on screen    fifty shades of grey does have a few moments and only a few  easily passable

every now and then a special film comes along the kind of film that defies all expectations and completely angers and disappoints you all at the same time this is the best way to describe the failure known as fifty shades of grey this is hands down one of the worst films i have ever seen not because of how controversial the subject matter is but by the sheer failure of every aspect a movie should succeed in first things first i have not read the books i saw this as someone who knew only minimal details about what this was about i honestly have no idea how to go about this review i normally start with the good then work my way down to the bad but here this is a colossal failure on every front the main issue here is the writing with the script being penned by kelly marcel marcels script is hands down one of the worst that has ever been written for a film every single line is so laughable and single handedly stupid you find yourself laughing in even the more serious parts word after word you grow more bored and  by the end of the film you simply do not care about anyone or anything that happened the characters are one dimensional and the romance is so rushed that you cant believe any of it not only that but the entire character of christian grey is nothing short of a sex offender and no matter how they try to dress him up there is just an unnerving air that isnt sexy but rather sad because he should honestly be in jail for his actions he is just that unlikable here the ending of the film is just a cheap way to set up a sequel and is nothing short of a sin to be so blatant and tasteless adding to this conundrum is the acting in the film jamie dornan and dakota johnson star and they dieliver some of the worst acting i have ever seen dornan plays christian grey a man with particular interests and a shady past dornan is beyond dreadful making his already silly lines even more ludicrous and you simply cant believe he is into the things he is johnson plays anastasia steele and she atleast tries to make this work but she is simply not capable of doing so her delivery is off way too childish and too passive when it comes to the dramatic scenes making this a stretch for anyone to even believe director sam taylorjohnson helmed this and she drops the ball in every single scene all her films have a style that only she can deliver but here she tries to establish a style early on but instead she just abandons it and it comes to the point where you can tell they are on a sound stage and not in seattle most shockingly taylorjohnson failed in the controversial sex scenes they arent racy or even shocking they are just as laughable as the script and the acting so basically this film even failed on the one thing the fan base is expecting  all in all i loathed every living second of fifty shades of grey this could have been a sleek and different kind of thriller but instead strives to be a subpar melodrama everything is so poorly done this is a chore to sit through this is not only one of the worst of the year so far but by far one of the worst films ever made skip this piece of filth and never look back

so i saw fifty shades last night gotta say if i had two thumbs to offer in separate review theyd both be up this presentation of a decidedly controversial topic was tastefully done and beautifully acted to boot cinematically it is gorgeous rich in detail not simply depicting the enviable sleek and often salacious lifestyle which simply radiates power among the affluent but also its pointedly cold and barren nature which mirrors christians own unconscious attempt to keep all emotion at bay his struggle will inevitably be a losing one however with early fractures in his veneer already telling in this the first film in the series in name of anna who simply exudes life simplicity warmth and honesty it would be a mistake not to read the excellent print behind the film as although this is a story of fiction with all the baggage of the latest controversy a bds lifestyle brings more importantly it is a character study and a good one at that in the same way that citizen kane or sophies choice or even one flew over the cuckoos nest was christian is by no means nicholson but to view this story in any other light would be a mistake to view this story as one solely about the bds lifestyle would be a mistake this initial film in the series is the beginning of a story spanning 3 literary works in print it is the story of growth and healing and a love story between two polar extremes not opposites per se but so absolutely far removed from one another that we keep shaking our heads smiling fully expecting their relationship to end at any moment thankfully for christian it does not here is a bit of the back story you do not see on screen and probably not until the second film born to a crack addicted prostitute mother as a toddler christian was starved for food daily even the most basic of simple attention and affection denied him by age 4 he is already scarred in so many ways not the least of which being burned repeatedly with cigarettes by her clients until finally he lay on the floor for days next to his mothers body after she was beaten to death christian survives and though he is adopted and made part of a loving family again at the age of 15 when he should be learning about holding hands and attending prom he is sought out and lured in by a despicable adult who introduces him to bdsm listen carefully here however as we find that he is not beyond selfredemption as he plunges headlong into his work which has made him a billionaire in areas promoting a sort of healing worldwide both as a benefactor of food and agriculture programs in developing countries and for technology offered in philanthropy rather than profit i dislike giving spoilers and will not however in an attempt to ameliorate or at least mediate in part some of the controversy from distracting from the work itself i can say that the ride along the way is fraught with angst as his darkness is exposed to the light of day through annas love for him and through dr flynn his insightful and often wryly humorous therapist he is in a sense born again into the light which is his anna through large doses of humility and a love which must be relearned leaving behind a clueless christian who finds himself in love and conquered well thankfully not completely in the end it is the daily struggle within christian to protect anna from himself which heals him the story concerns two people only both over 21 and is not one of rape or nonconsensual sex or sharing of any kind adults will not be turned to the dark side by watching or reading nor will teens although they should not be watching at all that said the lifestyle does exist however and we get the impression that it could be so much darker than we see this warning is inherent throughout the piece and is often lost in the controversy significantly we all come away with the impression that normal is not a word describing christian or the very worst of his lifestyle at the start of the story make no mistake this is not a story about a bds lifestyle or about a girl being taken advantage of because at 21 anna is perhaps one of the strongest women to come out of a fiction piece in a very long time while she is no jane austen character she may well be this centurys version of one

i read all the books i enjoyed the progression of the love story and the ups and downs of their relationship but i must say i was very disappointed in this film and it is not one elementits all of them     the cast  christian was originally suppose to be portrayed by charlie hunnam sons of anarchy and because of scheduling issues he had to pull out in my opinion they should have waited for him the actor that ended up being christian jamie dornan was less than alluring than hunnam how do you go from hunnam to dornan they are two opposite sides of the spectrum they should recast and retry this movie but if that is not possible they should at least recast the main characters christian was a serious disappointment    truthfully i didnt feel like any of the cast was fully committed to the characters therefore portrayed them poorly the portrayal was not convincing christian is no where near what he was described as in the book even if had i not read the books you couldnt sell me on the whole bdsmsexgod thing he isnt appealing enough nor does he have the on screen presence in any of the scenes that would make someone feel captivated by him christian grey is suppose to be enticing suave and undeniablei felt non of that at all   ana left more to be desired there were a few times where she seemed committed to the scenes and in other scenes it was like she was reading off of a teleprompter   i think that kate the roommate and the mothers were fine their parts arent that huge where they could do any more damage than what was being done by the main characters already elliot should be recast along with his brother elliot is supposed to be as handsome and tantalizing as christian just in a more ruggedcare free way he looked like he stepped out of the backwoods  of montana some where he reminded me of joe dirt thats not a good thing ray anas father was too loving and affectionate at graduation his entire character is about him being not so emotional or affectionate why would you make him emotional and overly affectionate when the last movie depends on that element of his personality   the only person who was properly cast in this film was taylor the bodyguard and that isnt saying much because he had very few lines in the  film any way the book was written very well and with very few tweaks like removing the inner monologues and removing a couple extra sex scenes it should have gone straight to film it makes me wonder if they have ever heard the proverb if it aint broke dont fix it i understand that it was the first movie and maybe they couldnt afford any alist actors but they could have got some solid raw talent from somewhere  and where the hell was ms jones how they just ton cut her out    the script  set  the script was just horrible they left out many details although they may seem small they foreshadow things that happen in the movie like she didnt interview for any jobs the whole second book therefore second movie if they even have one at this point is focused around her job at sip as is the third installment what clown decided to strike that from the script when it is the set up for the rest of the movies   lets not call this person a clown this person was most likely the smartest person in the room they must have figured out early that they project wouldnt make it past the first film so they just threw quality to the wind and went with it   this is a love story so changing scenes that remove the ebb and flow of their relationship and how they fall for each other and prove it is dumb  there is one scene where ana leaves christians condo and she is in her room and crying and what ever other dramatics and christian goes to her house fights past kate and makes his way to her even though he knows she is mad they left that out they left out all of his trips to her house except afterand its not about the lack of sex scenes they werent executed properly either but the book is more than the sexual encounters the love story didnt even make since in its development granted its a short time between meeting and falling in love but they didnt have to make it this bad   luckily the set design was pretty nice escala where he lives is set up the way it is in the book that was the most accurate part of the entire movie the kitchen was set up weird but i guess the breakfast bar got cut out with ms jones christians parents house was nice along with ana and kates apartment in seattle i didnt like the heathman hotel because it is describes as a grand suite with  not quite an apartment type set up but it does include a living room area where important scenes in the third movie should take place wheres the living room at it looked like they were at the ramada   i just feel bad for the director i want to say that they needed better direction but what can you really do with people that are just not right for a part     basically  this movie was a train wreck the kind that you can see transpiring but you just cant look away i wanted to love it i really did they just made it so so so challenging i know the movie made a lot of money but that is not a reflection of the quality of the film but the following of the book  this should have been a straight to dvd film or vh1 after dark presents because i regret paying to see this mess
