going to this movie without have read the books i was not expecting much however i was pleasantly surprised all though some the acting was a little less than believable in some aspects i realized that there was more to the story than just a man dominating a woman after seeing the movie i decided to read the books and find that i was rightthere is much more to this story the first book is not as exciting as the 2nd and 3rd in my opinion but acted more as a set up for the rest of the plot line there are a few different reasons that i see why people have given this movie a bad review 1 they did not read the books and do not understand how the story begins to unfold 2 people cannot get past the sm in the story but there is a reason why it has a such a large presence in the story 3 the fans of the series are upset with the casting choices but the truth is we get attached to the story and build these characters up that the actors are set up for failure trying to fufill peoples visions of how the character should portrayed overall while i do agree the connection between the actors could have been a little more believable i enjoyed the movie and cannot wait to see how the 2nd and 3rd books unfold on screen

tie me up let me down  my review of fifty shades of grey 2  12 stars    based on the originally selfpublished book by el james which originated as fan fiction of the twilight saga fifty shades of grey is as toothless as its inspiration and strangely enough bloodless  this is odd considering the bdsm nature of its central relationship      directed by sam taylorjohnson nowhere boy and adapted by kelly marcel saving mr banks the filmmakers appear to have borrowed more from its kinkier 1986 predecessor 9  12 weeks than from the aforementioned vampire trilogy  with sleek but barren 80sstyle production design by david wasco pulp fiction and uncharacteristically faceless cinematography from the usually brilliant seamus mcgarvey anna karenina atonement fifty shades feels like an empty product from a lost time  think flashdance with light domination instead of tight gyration  i mean jesus our heroine uses a flip phone fer crissakes  a flippin flip phone    fortunately that heroine is played by dakota johnson daughter to don johnson and melanie griffith and she is so good here that she almost makes the film worthwhile  i loved her on the shortlived sitcom ben and kate noting her ability to utilize terrific comic timing while making room for vulnerability  her style is highly reminiscent of her mothers who claimed she learned how to relax and breathe in front of the camera by working with mike nichols on her starmaking triumph working girl      her daughter has clearly taken her mothers advice and brings such charm to her role the character is anastasia steele a ridiculous name that i think even fabio would be embarrassed were he to pose for a book cover called the bodice rippings of anastasia steele  indeed its exactly where that character name belongs  regardless johnson is poised to become a huge star and her work here is deserving of praise    back to the story  anastasia is sent by her roommate kate who comes down with the flu eloise mumford a dead ringer for sienna miller to interview business tycoon christian grey jamie dornan in her stead  grey of course turns out to be young gorgeous and manipulative  they quickly fall for each other  you can tell because she chews her pencil and he stares at her  soon enough he admits to her that he doesnt do romance and instead prefers a dominantsubmissive relationship      naturally because hes rich great looking has a helicopter rents out gliders and owns a killer apartment she says yes  i suppose thats the aspirational appeal of this claptrap but lets not kid ourselves had christian grey been played by jonah hill as a homeless sexual deviant she would be spraying mace instead of her scent all over this stinker      eventually grey starts raising the stakes byumreally  he spanks her  he flogs her lightly  he covers her eyes and binds her hands with a necktie  im sorry but ive seen more subversive acts in a village people video than anything going on here  late in the film she asks grey to bring out the big guns  he chooses a simple belt to whip her a few grades harder than before but that damn belt was hanging next to notched paddles and fare edgier fare  why pull punches at the climax  many will say its because grey is developing feelings for anastasia  that would be true if i believed grey possessed them but as portrayed by dornan hes a onenote empty shell  sure thats the part he was hired to play and im sure dornan has some talent but hes just not given the chance  i kept waiting for something shocking  a cigar burn welts blood crazy zipper masks  i dont know  when did sex movies become so tame  this is just kinda boring meandering and oftentimes silly  its not the disaster everyone was fearinghoping for mainly because of johnson but its not gonna make anyone whip out a cm rag either shortbus seems so long ago

literature student anastasia steeles life changes forever when she meets handsome yet tormented billionaire christian grey    fifty shades is the story of anastasia steele dakota johnson a shy college literature student getting reading to graduate with her whole life ahead of her when a friend falls ill ana decides to help her friend out and interview charismatic but tormented billionaire christian grey jamie dornan when the interview turns into a flirting session mr grey develops an infatuation for ana and after some chance encounters and borderline stalking the two enter a dominant  submissive relationship however this billionaire has a haunted past thats has shaped him into a twisted adult and innocent ana struggles to decipher between love and lust in an attempt to break down mr greys emotional walls    based on the best selling el james fifty shades franchise of 2011 fifty shades of grey is the first entry into a proposed trilogy of literature for the jilted generation outside of the amazing cinematography and the fact sam taylor johnson was attached to direct its hard to praise this movie really dakota johnson puts in a serviceable performance but is shackled by the restraints of her character and when she isnt biting her lip 67 times in 125mins her lines are clunky and her appearance uninspired i know what your saying and it is what it is essentially its a book made extremely popular by repressed housewives on holiday bdsm enthusiasts and bandwagoners a movie was inevitable the fifty shades book franchise did achieve a positive goal i will add however it encouraged a generation albeit primarily female to start reading again you couldnt pick a more abysmal book to rekindle your love for literature but ill call it a win anyway jamie dornan plays the alpha male player very well and as a viewer with a limited knowledge of the plot i found the character quite entertaining i dont expect this movie to do well critically as it isnt very good to do the trilogy justice it should have been condensed to one movie but that would never happen as it would only equate to a third of the box office receipts however people are going to pour money into cinemas to see this movie because it has 14 mins of sex scenes and contrary to the highly cerebral storyline laugh out loud that is the only selling point outside of jamie doran of this production dont rush out to see it i wouldnt even recommend renting it can you still do that its not good at all unless your a fan of 2 dimensional acting stalking and domestic violence    futureproof movie review score i didnt think it was bad watching this movie i didnt expect much what i got were nice visuals a protagonist who felt real and a conflict that felt genuine i wasnt objecting to this movie in my head as it happened and it was surprisingly inoffensive and not just a mess of erotica sure these characters arent all that deep and their bondage even less so and the conflict does get repetitive towards the end but there wasnt anything in this movie that bothered or irritated me very much and there were actually some pluses   possibly the best part of the film was that the protagonist played by dakota johnson felt real johnson portrays her characters shyness without seeming fake and is able to sustain her realness even in weird situations where you might expect a stumble her relationship with christian grey was also believable she spends a whole lot of this movie objecting to christians ideas of a relationship asking the same questions that we have i found her easy to identify with within this movie that would not have worked at all without that due to the weird subject matter as the movie progresses and the conflict rises we even get a glimpse into the depth of christian grey who is totally onenote but why becomes the question that anastasia asks i felt like most of the movie we werent rooting for her to be christians submissive and i expected the audience to only want her to get fucked and whipped its not porn whatsoever expectation defied  speaking of subject matter which is getting this movie a ton of attention it seems much more dedicated to other aspects of its story this movie wasnt even sexy i didnt want it to be so thats fine some people might want that and might be disappointed but i didnt care the sex scenes werent too enjoyable for me and i couldnt tell how much the movie wanted me to be aroused by them the fact that the subject was different actually prevented this movie from being over familiar since we dont see this kind of relationship on film very often   the visuals are nice looking and best of all theyre spacious i could see this story being suffocated by mediocre cinematography but the director and cinematographer give us a lot of breathing room theyre slick and clean looking  there are stupid lines of dialogue sure i suspect that the director was aware of how silly these lines were and i think theyre supposed to make us laugh and they succeed the movie knows that you know what it is   problems sure there are some minor inconsistencies and ehh moments throughout the film but nothing that ruined it for me anastasias desire for a real relationship with christian the main conflict becomes pretty repetitive after a while this movie could have easily been twenty minutes shorter there is also a lack of depth in anastasias fascination with christian and his fascination with her their attraction is just that they love each other its surface level but thats good enough to work in this movie while i felt that anastasias character was real shes not that deep and nothing is revealed about her past christian is the opposite where he feels almost unreal but there are hints of depth in him most of which are left hanging by the end of the film i actually liked what the film left the audience hanging with and the decision that the protagonist ultimately made i can see a lot of people becoming bored somewhere towards the end of this film because of the repetitiveness of the story and blandness of parts especially if you want a lot of sex but i was into it most of the time   overall this movie surprised me theres nothing here that hints at greatness but i cant complain all that much i think if you want to go see this movie with some friends for fun or whatever go for it you could easily go into this movie wanting to hate it and getting exactly that but i think people who go in with an open mind might just find themselves enjoying it more than they expected

if youre going to adapt an awfully written book about sexual exploration and have laughable dialogue wooden performances and all round tepidness at least make the sexual exploration which is what audiences and fans of the book have come for interesting deep daring and not hampered by mainstream hollywood executives otherwise it simply wont satisfy the screenplay generates unintentional hilarity particularly when mr grey attempts street style slang george lucas would have laughed this script with this dialogue out of the board meeting  jamie doran is bland and stone faced maybe because thats what his character is but it doesnt make any kind of intense impression that personifies what anastasia undergoes in his presence dakota johnson utilizes her admittedly impressive skills as much as she can to give a solidly nervous and placid character performance but her abilities are aching for a better script to splash out on  its timid weak safe and artistically uninspired like watching a weekend fling between two strangers who we know nothing about progressing into various sexual antics and thenit stops there is no power in the story arc and the ending is such an anticlimax that i felt the need to go and watch lars von triers 4 hour long nymphomaniac to receive the edgy darling arthouse style erotica drama i expected to find watching fifty shades the whole malarkey has an elaborate uselessness about it it appears to serve the fans of the novel an unconfident adaptation one thats so scared to delve into the depths explored by e l james and instead choosing a mainly surface approach and brush away the awful prose the pages were written in whilst the script may read considerably better than the book the film is bland boring melodrama with no lasting impact whatsoever however when next year comes bringing the second book adaptation that may bring the tepidness back to the surface of my consciousness

fifty shades of grey really isnt all that bad  i do make sure to watch movies objectively as well as independent of what others maybe saying about them already  while the film is targeted at all the women who are so fondly attached to the book its not like this is a typical chick flick that men should be bored watching  i mean its pretty much all about sex  if anything the reason why most men are not interested in this phenomenon is that they figure the story is probably too tame for a book thats supposed to be about kink and sm  the book has been labeled mommy porn by many meaning its kinky in the eyes of the settleddown mother demographic  but its obviously reached much more than that as it has become so huge and the movie itself has been making a tremendous amount of money due to the anticipation of the books adaptation to film    while its maybe not as graphic as some other films its not completely timid either  the main character anastasia steele is told by christian grey right off the bat that he doesnt do the girlfriend thing and he doesnt make love he prefers another term for what he does  it becomes immediately clear that this no love story  grey is a dominant man looking for a woman who will be his submissive  he wants full control of the relationship and for the woman to pretty much cater to his every whim  he even makes out long detailed contracts for his women to sign if they agree to the situation  hes a rich man and must protect himself from any lawsuit  thats how hardcore the things he likes to do to women apparently are  of course the film doesnt show everything because then it would get an nc17 rating and not make nearly as much money  but aside from whatever amount of sex is shown its the characters that really make the movie work  the two stars are not wellknown but they do seem to have a strong chemistry on screen together and carry the entire film  more familiar faces like oscarwinner marcia gay harden and singer rita ora who is literally on screen for about 10 seconds are completely underused  but luckily the main two characters have enough screen presence to make the film watchable  it does however lack the depth of a better film from a dozen years ago called secretary which showed how an smtype relationship could actually be what brings 2 people to fall in love with each other  there really isnt any love here  just more of a strong connection  but its entertaining nonetheless  many women will love it but i dont think the guys will mind it as much as they think

trying to spice up soft core pulp by hard selling a limp romance this oftentimes dull adaptation of el james steamy novel ends up to be many shades shy of sexy or entertaining at least the movie tries classing up the joint the novels onenote first person prose wants for creativity so bad that it might as well be presenting an emotionless msdos conversation between a computer and user but many readers submitted wholeheartedly to this rudimentary format expectantly awaiting hwood to up the ante of their lurid fantasies with a full tilt boogie bells and whistles er whips and chains interpretation despite coloring in the grey areas by focusing on the courtship backstories of the two pyts and buildup to the sm in the first act the rest plays out like a whimpernot a bang its amazing how a flick with so many supposedly scintillating acts actually ends up to be boring even with all of the hard bodies and spanking no sparks fly between whats on screen and the audience worse moments and whole scenes abruptly just end nothing ahem climaxes its understood that christian grey isnt a romantic but his masochistic acts should at least elicit more than yawns from moviegoers    in this rrated adaptation of the erotic romance novel by el james literature student anastasia steeles johnson life changes forever when she meets handsome yet tormented billionaire christian grey dorman     director sam taylorwood attempts to bring some verve to their dating portion trying to get you invested in these rather colorless characters ultimately however she and screenwriter kelly marcel fail to make the goingson go flush with liveliness dakota johnson seems bound for bigger and better things despite this tourist trap stop in dullsville jamie dorman meanwhile sometimes looks the part but sometimes looks like he doesnt want to be there either    bottom line no spank you maam

this is a weird moviegoing experience its rare and awkward to see so many things bustling and fighting underneath the surface of a film while the actual film is just totally bland and boring although we did just recently see another one of these rarities in january with american sniper ive not read fifty shades of grey i do know its based on what began as twilight fanfiction and evolved into whatever we want to call it  most call it mommy porn or garbage  so it is but here is something rather unique whereas most hollywood films take a praised novel and turn it into garbage examples are vast and vary  see child of god hannibal the hobbit etc here we get a universally bashed trilogy of books and find the filmmakers attempting to make it into something better something more this is really a commendable trait i cant judge this movies based on the novel but i definitely sense something more in the movie something more as in perhaps a leveling down of sex and an increase in character development and story arc only the thing is none of it happens or succeeds whatever sam taylorjohnson was working for here falls completely flat theres actually some definite talent and potential though and thats what harms this movie so jamie dornan is a great actor as those that have seen the excellent underrated netflix series the fall can attest to here he shows no range whatsoever and delivers his lines and actions with total blankness christian grey is supposed to be an interesting titillating character  in this movie he is not seductive in the slightest dakota johnson sort of shines here but still falls short of what potential there is here is a character that is innocent signified with a heavy hand through her virginity but has the same curiosities and desires as anyone else  as most virgins do she enters into an interesting awkward somewhat frightening situation when she meets and falls for christian grey who has acquired tastes for some brutal love whats supposed to be a sexual awakening in the character of anastasia steele as described by author el james ends up simply being a negotiation of power in a somewhat abusive relationship there is certainly no sexual awakening here but im in no way inclined to say that type of subject matter is dead as some critics have reached in saying after seeing fifty shades  just look at the recent blue is the warmest color or wetlands this is a film marketed as a risky sexy film it is not there are many risky scenes of conversation about bdsm and only a couple scenes featuring such material but its all handled so lightly and with no intention to explore any themes the film is open to exploring it all becomes a bit unsatisfying and laughable the highlight of this film is the sleek greytoned cinematography by seamus mcgarvey i found myself entranced by the look of this film but repulsed by its bungling of already bungled material  its like seeing a glossy lustrous brand new aston martin and opening the doors only to find nothing inside void of any interior whatsoever so while this movie actually boasts some serious talent it does nothing with it while this movie actually tries to lift bad material out of the muck it fails while this movie actually makes money other better movies dont i dont recommend fifty shades of grey unless youre into awkwardly long romance films that carry no serious conversation about love and sex and no conclusion whatsoever seriously theres actually no conclusion to this movie  it ends in the middle of whatever kind of story its trying to convey while i give it bonus points for really trying i cant deny how bad it is

theres almost no reason to write anything about this movie everyone knows its bad the real question is it as ridiculous and sexridden as everyone hoped it would be the answer is both yes and no the movie begins gloriously with anastasia steele dakota johnson meeting mysterious entrepreneur christian grey jamie dornan in the most sexual tensionlaced scene ever he offers her a giant pencil she rubs it on her lips he smirks its heaven later they meet in a hardware store and he asks her where he can find some things  namely cable ties masking tape and rope wow she says youre the complete serial killer at the screening i saw the audience was in fits of laughter and applause for the first forty minutes  basically on a rocky horror level once the sex started happening though it went downhill the fact of the matter is that this movie shouldnt have been r director sam taylorjohnson and team credit must be given to both of these actors doing yeomans work make an immensely satisfying first act many argue that it isnt intentionally funny i tend to think they absolutely knew what they were doing but either dont have the courage of their convictions to up the ante as the story progresses or were straitjacketed by the mpaa regardless only one whip of christians thousands gets used and the energy very quickly fizzles after the foreplay is over this shouldve either been a ridiculous campfest or an offering to horny grandmothers everywhere as it stands its both and neither and thats just kinda lame

after some long thought about this film ive finally decided how im going to review this let me start by saying that this film doesnt fully represent its original erotic source material ive read a couple segments of the book online and the book is way more raunchier the film removes content to make it fit a showable r rated film so all the people that are against seeing this based on that reason alone can calm down because its not crazy bad this film is not pornography the nudity is tasteful and filmed elegantly its a film that is focused on its story in which the nudity is just a supporting part of the story like titanic her gone girl and wild the reason why people should avoid seeing this is for the abuse that the main character gives to other main character in this movie and to avoid having it being replicated in real life    now to address everything else this film has a very fast pace the lighting is good the film features color schemes of grey throughout the film the set design is great and music scoresoundtrack is excellent actor performances arent ground breaking but are alright the story however is weird and leaves a strange taste in your mouth you dont figure out why things happen and the film ends abruptly forcing you watch the next film to find out what is going on i dont necessarily like this film but i dont hate it its a film that looks great but has a weird story this film will be remembered for its hype more than anything

ive read all the books  they are not works of art they are not even wellwritten or welledited but what they do offer is some really steamy scenes and a look into a lifestyle that most regular people havent even heard about    i was excited about the movie but i was concerned it was just going to translate into a bad porno  because lets face it the book doesnt do a great job at character development  and the story itself is very flimsy    what a joy it was to see such a wellcast wellacted welldirected movie that was quite beautiful and sexy visually and had a great sense of humor the book didnt have these qualities      i can see how this movie is being pannedit doesnt have much substance  and christian is a morbid grumpy character  he should have been more charming but wasnt  and this is what i dont get  jamie is sexy and charming as heck and he does some sexy and charming things in the movie  he just didnt come across the same way as he did in the book  regardless if this is the fault of the actor director or screenwriter  or all three for that matter the one thing that redeems it is that dakota is perfect as ana  and since the original story is from her perspective i think they set out to achieve what needed to be achieved    i just feel grateful that this movie wasnt a bad porno and that the red room scenes were tame  it allowed me to enjoy the characters themselves without being distracted by the other stuff    i want to see it again and i want to see the sequels  i love all the actors cast and i cant wait to see more of the others

the film was highly expected following the worldwide success of the series of book about the intriguing young wealthy self made christian grey as always with material based on a popular book the film will divide trigger and create a few debates personally i havent red the books and didnt read much about the film i went it with no expectations first of all i would praise the esthetic of the film which displays an interesting range of greys it may not be the kind of details most people will go for  but visually speaking it gives the film an amazing texture and sets the mood of a film clearly looking and feeling like the mind of the main character its a fascinating crafted film where colors and atmosphere play a huge part on the setting of the story some scenes especially the one where sitting at a table and facing eachothers in mr greys office bathed in a deep orange  redpink the two protagonist review the contract in  a scene that manages to be both incredibly erotic and funny  it seems we are looking at a magnificent sunset created inside an office sam taylorjohnson is a very smart woman and has made a film as good as she could from a material that isnt in the end very substantial but will appear provocative and new to a whole group of people whos sexual life isnt thrilling or daring personally i couldnt care more about the story stories have all been told already and if you look into literature for example im sure some authors such as the marquis de sade would win the grand prize of daring controversial  subjects in a far more glorious way than this one now that being said what i enjoyed with this film is the journey of anastasia she is far more intriguing interesting and appealing to the audience than mr grey she accepts to enter a universe she doesnt know and willingly explore her sexuality unfortunately for herself to a man whos so prisoner of his own habits he may very well be losing it all and pass next to happiness without even noticing it the names of the characters are giving it away he is grey she is steele not so subtle but efficient with the relationship dominant dominee i always felt that the dominee somehow ends up possessing the dominee far more than one would expect and i was very glad to see this on screen few people might actually get it but if you think about it it makes sense anastasia accepts to explore she is thus opening her fan of possibilities in life and becomes extremely stronger than christian grey because she is obviously smart and possess values grey on his side is very much tributary of his passion desires and ways which makes him the real prisoner the real dependent one the film will appear first as a huge sexist and bias vision but i am convinced there is more to it and some subtleties will pass unnoticed for most of the audience its a mature look at the exploration of love and sexual desire done in an interesting graphic way but i would say that in the end the story feels a little dull n over dramatic to fully convinced if grey had been willing to exchange places every once in a while and make anastasia the dominant the film would have been far more interesting like the recent roman polanskis venus in fur an amazing twisted study of malefemale relationship and who truly dominate in the end but i may be anticipating the next two books who will certainly be turned into films in the near future following the epic record of popularity at the box office america with its usual complexesfrustrations regarding sexuality may find something to chew on for a while with such material to resume its a film that will either reach you and intrigue you or will plainly annoy you and bore you to death as with all things in life there is two ways to look at it if not more and it will be your choice to see in it what you want to see

well heres the review youve been waiting for im going to go against the tide and tell you that fifty shades of grey is a good movie i agree with one reviewer who suggested that if the movie was in french and had english subtitles the critics would probably be raving about it i dont know why so many think this is a bad movie  maybe because they were expecting it to have as much sex in it as the books  it doesnt fortunately the director sam taylorjohnson has stripped away the poor writing of the book and produced a film that is worthy of a viewing    the dialogue between christian jamie dornan and anastasia dakota johnson is more intelligent and witty than the book there is quite a good sense of humour portrayed by the two as they develop their relationship anastasia is intelligent confident and in control of herself and the situation in fact dakota johnson is superb in her role giving us a nuanced performance with emotional depth jamie dornan slowly develops his character as he is challenged by anastasia resisting his attempts to control her while yearning for a normal romantic relationship anastasias character develops nicely over the course of the narrative the soundtrack is good with contemporary songs supporting the story the cinematography by seamus mcgarvey the avengers atonement is excellent    in my view fifty shades can be seen to reflect much of what women experience in traditional marriages  particularly conservative religious marriages the husband as the head of the household wants to control what goes on while women are told to submit to their husbands in order to find true happiness and freedom the difference in the movie is that unlike many conservative religious marriages the woman can say no and leave the relationship easily seen from this perspective fifty shades is actually a critique of this form of relationship ill leave viewers to think further on this if they wish    fifty shades is a smartly provocative  story with a stunning finale that leaves us hanging waiting for the next instalment if the second episode does as good a job of stripping away the cringeworthy aspects of the books it will be worth seeing where the story goes

fifty shade of grey is dry  the male lead actor seems impossibly uncomfortable in his own skin  his facial expressions are over rehearsed and non convincing  his movements are awkward and clumsy  he does not come across as a force to be reckoned with  part of the first scene with him shows him slouching in a chair  very unimpressive  after awhile the female lead becomes boring  i get that she is supposed to be shy but when it would seem like a scene would require more strength from a voice or an action it is never achieved  the film as a whole requires the music and as usual danny elfman delivers to carry it because neither of the two main actors can seriously convince the audience that they could do anything more than just walk through their job  marcia gay harding who portrays the mother truly adds no more to the character then to just simply be seen on the screen  the roommate and brother that are suppose to get together is so glossed over that you wonder why they even had a part  this is what we get when they take a poorly written book and attempt to milk out a few more pennies but can give you nothing better than what was in the pages

fifty shades of grey is a movie that i frankly believe did not need to be made nor should have been made at all the book is very racy and graphic from what i hear and it is virtually impossible to make a movie out of a bdsm torture porn concept without giving it an nc17 rating the problem is of course that if the movie was rated nc17 it would have precluded anyone under 17 from screening the movie thus reducing ticket sales the end product here is a mediocre film with a flat lifeless script that most likely doesnt measure up to the book i dont think many viewers would feel stimulated to read the books after watching the movie adaptation the acting is not all that bad the actors just have nothing to work with and the movie never feels as compelling as it should be most of the porn is watered down and tame which doesnt have nearly the effect its supposed to the film has a hard time getting going and ends on a cliffhanger that feels rather awkward for an ending i cannot say from a stylistic standpoint that i enjoyed this movie at all while the connection between anastasia and christian feels real the film feels devoid of any purpose at all the whole film is greys attempt to seduce anastasia and strip her of any individuality or identity at all he wants to own her in every sense of the word and create total repression for her both emotional and physical the fact that this film didnt work should send a sign to the director not to produce the next two films  c

so i have now seen 50 shades of grey twice now and throughly enjoyed it both times even more so the second time     i understand that the first time you watch a film you can kind of still enjoy it even if its terrible due to the fact that is the first time you are watching it the second time i watched it i was consciously thinking whether i was bored and i wasnt i was always engaged and enjoying it to be honest the films pace is a lot better than a lot of films there are no unnecessary scenes things are just constantly happening  and never stopping the plot is always moving forward or giving a humoroussexy scene contrary to popular belief i believe the humour is very intentional and was impressed how it balanced serious and comedic scenes     how do i explain the plot in a family friendly way boy meets girl boy wants girl in his playroom which for clarification does not have an xbox in and that is all i can really say     those scenes had two very beautiful people that yes had me hot under the collar i didnt feel i could review it without briefly mentioning them    as far as the ending goes i can understand people feel it is a bit abrupt but it definitely leaves you wanting more and at a turning point in the story    the acting in this film from the two leads are terrific and more on point than i think people realise     lets start with dakota johnson she is clearly the star here and it is a joy to watch her grow as a character there is a great arc to her character and she portrays it beautifully i am really looking forward to seeing more from her in the sequels and other projects     now as far as jamie dornan goes i cant believe how much abuse this guy is getting for his performance the main argument is that his acting is wooden this is deliberate and on purpose and you can see that this is how the character is at a very basic explanation without spoilers he is a very closed book character but all that being said towards the end of the film he does actually show more emotion and i know he can act because he was great in once upon a time     50 shades of grey has beautiful cinematography with perfect angles and lovely colours it has a very clean and sleek finish that fits the film perfectly    the director sam taylor johnson knew exactly how to direct the actors in each scene understanding and portraying the scene clearly to the audience    i love the soundtrack to this film it has been stuck in my head since i first saw it even right this second and again fits scenes perfectly    i had so much fun with fifty shades of grey and would happily see it many more times and am very much looking forward to the next one

ok so here are my toughts on fifty shades of grey the movie i have a lot to say so bear with me  i loved the book to movie adaptation overall the movie is basically just like the book there were a few scenes that had to be left out but there was no way they could translate the entire book into the movie let me remind all of you that the book is a little over 500 pages and the movie is only about 2 hours long obviously they had to cut a lot of things out including the blue string scene that im sure a lot of people are aware of in my opinion they cut out many of the scenes that were considered controversial   the sex scenes were tastefully done sam taylorjohnson the director did an excellent job with this movie she made it very tasteful and easier to accept this film could have gone in a very bad direction but thank god it didnt    dakota did an amazing job of portraying every facet of ana she was confident awkward shy and funny all at the same time   i am a huge charlie hunnam fan  i was upset when he backed out and doubted at first jamie being casthowever after seeing the movie jamie is christian he brought the stiff standoffish cold older in manner than years christian from book 1 to life i could see his struggles with realizing he actually felt real emotions about a woman the struggle with changing for her staying away from her honestly after watching the movie i cant see anyone else as christian or ana  i know that every woman has her own sort of envisioning grey and its normal to be disappointed but it does not give them the right to talk bad about him because he did his part excellent in book 2 fifty shades darker christian really starts to evolve and we learn more about him and i cant wait to see jamie bring fsd christian to life  im done so go see it especially if you like the book

while many critics both professional and otherwise are slamming this movie left and right i think the most unbelievable thing about this movie is its audience despite its obviouslyadult premise moviegoers are acting like a bunch of children with their disappointment so lets be clear going to a movie to watch hardcore sex is like watching a porno for the acting dont be stupid for one there are censors and two there are these new things called women if you havent slept with one by now you probably arent familiar with their peculiar sense of intrigue and suspense about the bedroom yeah its weird and yeah it isnt as graphic as we men are used to so accordingly i set my sexual expectations for this movie very low going in and youd be a fool in my humble opinion to do otherwise    that said i was pleasantly surprised by the build up if youll recall the best thing about the matrix was you didnt know it was going to be anything special for a summer action movie there wasnt a lot of explanation or promotion for the film so when it turned out to be different than what we all expected we were amazed the followup movies not being even remotely capable of recreating that sense of the unexpected predictably suffered a terrible death 50 shades was the opposite of revolutions for me in that it had all the negative advertising ahead of it with a surprise treatment that made it interesting and ill draw another parallel criticizing dornan for his portrayal of grey is like criticizing reaves for his portrayal of neo it was actually a good fit regardless of what you think of their actual skill and played well for the story    i was surprised too by the brave ending ive never read the books and my girlfriend hasnt finished the first so i didnt know where they were going with it and they didnt go for a feelgood finish quite the opposite so kudos to them for that    so to wrap this up the negativity surrounding this movie is overdone if you can take this movie for what its supposed to be a journey for a naive person into a world unfamiliar youll enjoy it for where it takes you if you dont take it so seriously youll be able to laugh when they negotiate both anal and vaginal fisting like a couple of professional business partners because youre supposed to

spoiler alert a review of this film only really makes sense with reference to the denouement   my guess is that part of the problem that some people have found with fifty shades as a film lies in audience expectation so ill skip references to the book and focus on the bigscreen version   there is a definite feel particularly in the early stages of the direction of fifty shades leaning towards fashioning a pretty woman for a highly sexed demographic poor girl falls for rich boy feels out of place but gradually adapts to his affluent and manly ways while teaching him the power of love in return this pattern is virtually a genre in itself and i could well imagine richard gere as christian grey the initial surface niceness of the characters in fifty shades though removes much of even the mild social tension underlying the premise of pretty woman and makes for an opening with even fewer dimensions as the first moves of the film drifted in this direction i found myself settling down for an evening of predictability romcom with the puns replaced by ropes  however although social status in fifty shades provides the opportunity for a couple of standard set pieces on the lifestyle of wealth cars helicopters the like the film is more about sexual mores which is where the audience expectation comes into play in this dimension in trying to forge its own identity the cinematography dallies with the slowpanning style of soft porn while sharing a certain pouty artistic attitude with pedro almodÃ³var but it never really finds the cojones to go full frontal physically or psychologically   there are amid this worthy moments like the business negotiation of a contract defining sexual limits that let the audience titter knowingly at terms and taboos and this is where the films dramatic tension is built in a fairly traditional will shewont she format flavoured with the taboo topics of bondagedominancesadism    plenty of material for discussion is to be found here the attitude on one side of the fence might be that deviation from sexual norms may be bad as in unpleasant while the attitude on the other side of the fence with the swingers and hedonists may be that more conservative traditions are bad as in dull or repressed  fifty shades focuses largely on two individuals exploring some aspects of this discussion and evolves fairly naturally into a question of how far is too far  and so to the denouement  the rounds of imagery of submission have by this point added several layers of symbolism to the couples intimacy and the sacrifice that one individual makes to bring the other catharsis becomes visually and emotionally strong  it is an act of selfsacrifice that through the imagery of submission and defeat achieves a victory of selfdetermination  this doesnt result in an archetypal hollywood happy ending  however for me it is stronger as a consequence and as such it is almost a pity that a sequel is all but inevitable

after all the hype the worldwide phenomenon that women around the world have been gushing over finally hits the big screen fifty shades of grey has been known for its graphic depiction of bdsm and steamy sex scenes that have women glued to the pages going in i thought i was going to see some intense stuff after leaving the theater i wondered thats it first off when seeing a movie based on a book based on a twilight fan fiction you know you are not going to get casablanca or an affair to remember there really isnt much story it is just about a girl who meets a guy who likes to have sex and do it with his toys the fact that there is a trilogy is mindboggling but i have seen worse this leaves the two leads to make the movie interesting jamie dornan and dakota johnson do a good job in their roles it is not their fault the dialogue is often laughable and dry though jamie dornan is every bit of a leading man i hated christian grey to me he came off as a creepy dude who had control issues and not once was i rooting for him on the other hand dakota johnson is likable as anastasia steele the script doesnt give her a lot to work with but she is able to make the performance passable when other actresses might have given a kristen stewartlike performance in fact johnson is the best part of the movie when it came to the sex scenes though they were graphic and sensual something was missing just like the grey character the entire movie had no genuine emotion i have seen more emotion from a sappy pg13 nicholas sparks adaptation from start to finish it was just blah however the cinematography and soundtrack were actually good there was no raunchiness about anything despite the main characters choice of sex life this is one of the cases where the movie could have benefited had it gotten an nc17 rating and actually got into the more detailed stuff from the book why not the rating is not as taboo as people make it out to be and i think fans would have appreciated more fans will probably still love the more toned down rrated version but nonfans and brave boyfriends and husbands will wonder how this story even got published in the first place     grade c

im a romance author who liked 50 shades but also recognized it had lots of problems but i give it credit for getting everyone talking about womens sexuality and thats a good thing i discuss this at length in my romance beat article that book and now that movie and what to do about it link below i approached sexperts sex educators and an erotic romance authors for their viewpoint as well the gist of the article is since i thought the book helped get us talking we should continue that by standing up and being counted so i promised to see the movie although i had low expectations given the movie trailers i went to opening night and was counted as a fannot a screaming cheering fan like the hordes that filled the theater but i was there munching popcorn and hopeful    and that hope was fulfilled and then some the movie was good even great at times a little slow at the beginning but i think thats because all the movies now move at such a hyper pace its unusual to watch a movie that takes its time then when it does ramp up wow the director came through and made an enjoyable movie without the issues so problematic in the book    even in the pivotal beating scene i could feel christians motivation understand he was exercising his demons in the only way he knows how and see his conflicting love for ana even as he hits her doesnt make it right that he does this needs thisand ana as we know from the book doesnt put up with it but it made sense to me more than it did in the book    i had a second hope for the movie that it would help move the discussion of womens sexuality forwardi realized as i sat and watched that it wont do this the movie is good entertainment the sex scenes artfully done but the books ability to shock to raise awareness about alternative lifestyles to get people talking has already done its jobwhether that was e l james intention or notand the movie doesnt really add to that not when its so entertaining and fun i think that was my mistake layering too many hopes onto one film    so was it the best movie ever made no but it is a very good romance not for everyone not for men that want a car chase or knife fight in every scene but for anyone who wants a romance that is different unusual breaks the moldthis is for you and for anyone that wants to try a new toywatch for the bunny flogger hanging in the red room of pain trust me its sensualicious

fifty shades of fed up  a quote by christian grey and a review by mando and watkins  from a book that sold millions of copies to sex mad individuals hungry for that one piece of bondage to send them sky high without the actual need to watch a porno then it becomes almost common sense for a film of the book to be made considering how to books sold over 100 million copies in 52 different languages then it become very understandable why a film with so much money potential would be made and wait is finally over fifty shades has exploded onto the scene with a whip smack and a rope burn on to our wallets already making a huge 80 million on its opening weekend and i can say for fans of the book you will be pleased however if youre like me and havent read the books and are judging this purely as just a film then it just doesnt pay off in fact its a complete disaster  the film follows anastasia steele played by dakota johnson visiting the wealthy businessman christian grey played by jamie dornan as favour to her roommate in order to interview him what follows is a mixture odd stalking helicopter rides and epic sex rooms which involves a push and pull relationship between the two with steele falling in love and wanting a normal relationship while grey simply wants a just sexual one only with lots and lots of rope and more whips than a horse race johnson one of the stars of the film makes an admirable leads with her playing the role of nervous girl trying to find love well and well dornan does try his best to create a dark and mysterious character it falls flat with the character appearing as more of creepy stalker than a romantic lover with him doing some odd things such as just appearing a steeles place of work while starring at her and how he states how she is his im pretty sure what youre doing is a criminal offence mr grey and you should be in jail if people in prison like having anal sex as much ana steele does who should be pretty happy  its not all dornans fault however as the whole plot and script to the movie is goddamn awful the director sam taylorjohnson who is behind the very good and underappreciated nowhere boy also trys her best with some sleek and stylish direction that makes an admirable effort and helps keep my attention with some good landscape shots along with a descent soundtrack to back it up she ever directs well the most important scenes to hardcore fans the sex scenes her scenes will impress for both men and women with plenty of scenes of dakota johnsons boobs and butt and jamie dornans abs and cock i think its fair to say that many children will be conceived after their future parents go to see this movie together but in fairness the film decides to not focus on that as much and instead trys to focus on the story its just a shame there isnt one the story is poor and nothing at all interesting actually happens in the film an overview of the entire film is basically  grey hey ana wanna fuck with ropes  ana yes mr grey i would love to  grey great i will get the whips  ana actually this isnt for me  grey oh thats a shame  fin  and that is the whole fucking movie the dialogue doesnt help either and instead left laughing at some of the poor pieces of dialogue mainly from dornans character with such quotes as you dont understand me im fifty shades of fucked up and when he calls taking steeles virginity as rectifying the situation had me in tears of laughter so much laughter i was worried that the countless on 50 women in the cinema would attack me in their cougar rage for daring to mock their precious christian  this makes me question why the hell the film would try to follow the book so much as its pretty clear they have been following the book to death however when the main appeal of the book is the sex and i have even spoke to readers of the book who all agree that the book is manly sex and very little plot so why the hell didnt they add more to the plot when the plot from the book was so thin and that was their main focus the book has a silly plot which should be embarrassed by it silliness and almost make a parody of itself and not take itself too seriously but instead trys to show how serious it should be seen as and that just makes the film all that worse as a result of that  verdict  fsog is a book that diehard fans of the book will love but on whole a film for normal film goers its just another example of a poor romcom despite the performances of johnson and dornan and the direction of taylorjohnson trying to hold it up it fails over its poor story laughable script and lack of truly embracing its silliness makes this more of a fifty shades of fucked up kind of movie as quoted by grey himself  25 stars

february 13 2015    because el james fifty shades of grey trilogy has sold over 100 million copies worldwide it stands to reason the movie version would at least be interesting then again we might have thought the same thing about twilight and well i guess some books only make for appealing cinema when youre a loyal reader of the source and therefore might be more willing to forgive the movie some of its flaws for the rest of us though sitting through it can be a trying experience     after seeing fifty shades of grey i can understand what the buzz surrounding it could have been about which is not to say i felt any buzz while watching it my hope was that it would be an aggressive assault on the senses and go beyond risquÃ© but its surprisingly dull and inconsequential for such a wouldbe sensual drama     perhaps the problem was my expectations were too high or just plain wrong after all i have not read the novel and after seeing the movie i have no intention to but my views were no doubt shaped by its popularity not to mention the controversial nature of the material and the checkoutline gossip regarding the movies casting and the hype about who was going to play the dominant mr grey and the submissive anastasia steele all this prepared me what would hopefully function as entertaining trash    but entertaining it is not as the movie is simply not well made the filmmakers seem all too aware of the books societal influence and probably assumed either consciously or subconsciously they wouldnt have do much in order to sell itthat a mere shotbyshot straightforward adaptation of james pages would be enough to satiate audiences this explains why i got no sense of adventure from director sam taylorjohnson who doesnt lend the movie any notable style or energy she also seems uncertain of what type of movie she was making either solemn romance or illicit fantasy the constant teetering between the two and our subsequent confusion on how to take it contributes to the movie being a bore    so whats it actually about odds are youre already aware of the premise which is essentially a classic fairy tale albeit with a naughty twist not unlike snow white cinderella or anastasia it follows a smart skinny and prudish girl named whaddya know anastasia dakota johnson a 21yearold college student who meets a 27yearold billionaire ie prince charming named christian grey jamie dornan who heads his own telecommunications enterprise in seattle they meet when anastasia fills in for her roommate eloise mumford and interviews mr grey for their school paper because hes this years commencement speaker     at first anastasia asks mr grey all the usual questions like to what do you attribute your success then out of nowhere she asks him if hes gay granted this what her roommate had written down but anastasia wants to know herself because its obvious this guy has immediately smitten her with his designer clothes perfect body and killer good looks of course were supposed to assume anastasia is still sexually pure what with her conservative attire humble disposition and the fact that she wears her hair up the movie does everything except provide her nerd glasses all this is done so we can eventually see her transform from ugly duckling to beautiful princess    his answer to being a homosexual is no but that doesnt mean mr grey isnt keeping some facts about himself in the closet and herein lies the naughty twist spoiler alert mr grey is a sadist he doesnt do the traditional dating thing or even sleep in the same bed with the women he sees instead he presents them with a legally binding contract that stipulates hes the dominant and shes the submissive his relationships do not revolve around things like intimate conversations dinners movies and holding hands but on punishing women     for the women he assures them its strictly voluntary and says they can walk away at any time but he also promises theyll enjoy their shared exploits if the woman signs the contract he shows her his play room where he keeps things like rope cables whips and blindfolds mr grey isnt they type of man who skimps on quality including accessories for sadomasochism however anastasia isnt like all the other women hes been withher innocence and selfrespect complicate things which of course only draws these two individuals closer together but will their opposing backgrounds and unorthodox relationship allow their their love to be realized    thats the ageold fairy tale question but the problem with fifty shades of grey is it plods along at such a slow and meandering pace we start to not care about the answer too early on even during anastasia and christians first encounter my mind was wandering because the actors embodying these wouldbe complex characters exhibited almost no enthusiasm for their juicy roles and generated little to no chemistry i never even got the sense johnson and dornan were real actors but more like two regular people reciting lines at every stage of their relationship they come across as unbearably stiff and not very credible they lack essentially personalities despite what they do in the bedroom    funnily enough kelly marcels screenplay doesnt approach the material with any sense of irony or selfawareness like we might expect so when the characters speak their often ludicrous and soap opera dialogue the movie doesnt intend for us to laugh at it this would have been fine the movie doesnt have to be hip to itself had the characters actually possessed any weight and dimension but theyre so lifeless that what they say just doesnt resonate theyre passive not only to each other but also to what theyre doing and that translates to us    one of the films only bright spots is marcia gay harden as christians adopted mother her character was the only one i wanted to spend time with and not because shes necessarily interesting but because shes the only one that seemed real and human by comparison anastasia and christian are dull and robotic and by the time christian finally explains his motivations for his private life were so far removed from the story that we dont really care to know its not what he does or says thats offputting its that we simply dont care    fifty shades of grey may have people talking before they see it but i highly doubt it will spark many conversations afterward not when theres so little to it provocative material can only go so far unless something interesting is actually done with it and the makers of fifty of shades of grey dont do a whole lot with what they have i expected and hoped this movie would be a lot of things sexy romantic fun funny or even sleazy but boring  that came as an unpleasant surprise

anastasia ana steele is a 21yearold college senior attending washington state university in vancouver washington with her best friend katherine kate kavanagh who writes for the student newspaper due to an illness kate persuades ana to take her place and interview 27yearold christian grey an incredibly successful and wealthy young entrepreneur in seattle ana is instantly attracted to christian but also finds him intimidating as a result she stumbles through the interview asking questions about his personal life and relationships and leaves christians office believing that it went badly ana tries to console herself thinking the two of them will probably never meet again however she is surprised when christian appears at claytons the largest independent hardware store in the portland area where she works while he purchases various items including cable ties masking tape and rope ana informs christian that kate would like some photographs to go along with her article about him christian leaves ana with his phone number later that day kate urges ana to call christian and arrange a photo shoot with their photographer friend josÃ© rodriguez    the next day josÃ© kate and ana arrive for the photo shoot at the heathman hotel where christian is staying and christian asks ana out for coffee the two talk over coffee and christian asks ana if shes dating anyone specifically josÃ© when ana replies that she isnt dating anyone christian begins to ask her about her family during the conversation ana learns that christian is also single but is not a hearts and flowers kind of guy this warning intrigues ana especially after he pulls her out of the path of an oncoming cyclist however ana believes that she is not attractive enough for christian much to the chagrin of kate after finishing her exams ana receives a package from christian containing first edition copies of tess of the durbervilles which stuns her later that night ana goes out drinking with her friends and ends up drunk dialing christian who informs her that he will be coming to pick her up because of her inebriated state ana goes outside to get some fresh air and josÃ© attempts to kiss her but he is stopped by christians arrival ana leaves with christian but not before she discovers that kate has been flirting with christians brother elliot later ana wakes to find herself in christians hotel room where he scolds her for not taking proper care of herself christian then reveals that he would like to have sex with her he initially says that ana will first have to fill out paperwork but later goes back on this statement after making out with her in the elevator

how about this how about a screenwriter take on a book that captures the ideas and direction of the book long story but tailors the story to fit into a movie length and context unfortunately in this adaptation of fifty shades of grey we get way too much checklisting from the book at the expense of a cohesive flowing narrative written to create an absorbing movie going experience      original writer el james joins three other writers in the scripting of her famous book about love versus sexual obsession unfortunately what we experience in this movie is a constant jarring jolt of moments when points of the book are brought up to remind the audience that they have already read this story having read the book myself i felt pandered to not serviced by the constant niggling little points that keep coming up even when they arent needed if they had structured similar ideas with a little creative flair and fewer instances then perhaps we could see not the adaptation of  fifty shades of grey but instead fifty shades of grey the movie it can be done       actors jamie doran and dakota johnson are well cast as the movies two main leads and each has a special quality that makes their roles effective johnson is titular in the girl next door role and performs well with a few moments of backbone which are refreshing and appropriate doran is steely and intense with magnetic eyes which make up for a lack of bulk in his physical presence but since his heroine is smallish herself this is a minor point      other characters either seem less developed like anastasias buddy kate who is simply the shakespearian sounding board for anas inner thoughts to be relayed to the audience and not much of a  point of potential conflict as she was in the book while other characters seem cliched versions of what has gone before and were meant to fit into a type as were the actors chosen to portray them ie the divorce mom the lower class suitor the rowdy trouble making brother ho hum but this is just one more instance of the paint by numbers movie construction    there are of course quite a few sex scenes as there would be in such a production they do help to complete the visual narrative from the book in all its soft core salacious excess though visually stunning in its presentation lush and evocative it brings an interesting contrast to an underlying psychological problem that permeates the movie as a whole that being i think best summed up in a question when it comes to love and sex who is master and who is slave which one leads and which one follows one would automatically know the answer to this in a civilized society but to make a study of it requires a definitive answer that will only be socially responsible considering the public welfare of such things when balancing between the banal truth of life and the attempt to capitalize on the publics penchant for spending money on sensationalism    anastasia of course has deep attraction for the mysterious rich fellow who shows up in her life and turns it upside down as love is want to do to the average work a day girl or cinderella    christian grey finds this simple student and hardware store worker girl an actual challenge to his life filled with financial excess choppers and gliders a garage full of expensive cars and a huge expensively outfitted home  which is sadly and not coincidentally empty     fruits of ones labor being true to form success takes work often too much work and only decorates the walls of ones life while leaving what could be the creamy center void in this way christians obsession for the lurid sexual life that he finds himself in is a double edge sword of kink idolatry     he is revealed to be a liar on several moments of personal revelation once the brutal terminal ending arrives as the commitment to sex over love proves to be too much even in the face of the love that promises that the marriage bed is not defiled     anastasias hopeful risky challenge has all sorts of hidden subtext as she tests the heart of her suitor only to find his psychology an horrific fit and a vile insult to her own heart and emotions the ending something akin to a slamming door had the audience in the theater gasping and moaning in disbelief my own response yeah well this isnt the internet folks    three out of five stars

okay i got dragged along to this film  it really had a lot of pressure to live up to the book of the same name by author el james and its hoard of mainly middle aged female fanatics  the antics of a high flying seattle based businessman christian grey  grey doesnt sleep in the same bed as women he describes himself as fifty shades fucked up  the film is like one of those smutty mills and boon books that your relative used to read whilst baby sitting you in your childhood  here it concerns some coming of sexual age female character anastasia steele becoming embroiled in the dominant bdsm life of grey complete with a play room a red room of pain  this review makes the film sound pornographic which it isnt its just a lurid tale of sexual innuendo  the film has ample screenplay material a trio of books and it ends set up for a sequel  grey is obsessed with drawing up a contract for ana the contract forms the backbone of the film for a good twenty minutes raising laughs along the way with its lurid contents being discussed in a boardroom like an episode of the apprentice   that is all i have to add

name by rl james the movie is about a naÃ¯ve girl named anastasia played by dakota johnson whom falls in love with a rich billionaire christian grey portrayed by jamie dornan after a bizarre interview she makes for her friend mr grey seems to be interested in anastasia but he doesnt do romance and makes her enter a relationship of bdsm and as for the rest of the film is him trying to convince her turning a soft core porn novel into a blockbuster film was no easy task turning every womans fantastical vision of christian grey into reality was virtually impossibly but taylorjohnson turned a mediocrely yet incredibly engaging novel into exactly what the shades reader needed fifty shades reminded every woman why she woke her husband up in the middle of the night for spontaneous booty why she desired for her arms to be pinned over her head why she fell in love in the first place the film satisfied every image in my head and without being a lifetime movie or cinemax late night special fifty shades did exactly what needed to be done    jamie dornan has been criticized for his stiff portrayal of grey however his stiffly covered accent contrasted perfectly with his playful and passionate moments physically no man could live up to the expectations in which james wrote grey but dornans dark squint while showing his disdain for ana leaving for georgia his pouty lips while smiling as she negotiates the contract from across the table and his body while slowly mounting her naked body in the red room of pain allowed for a slow love to grow for this character     most amazing though was dakota johnson as ana steele as i read the narrator in the novel i only pictured kristen stewarts whiny persona and i hated every aspect of the character in no way did i read her as deserving of christian but johnson made her beautiful close ups excite the viewer and her acting was humorous sexy and believable as a college student i understood exactly why grey loved her     as a movie viewer who rarely sees romantic films i was pleased as i left the theatre and am ready for the sequel

as far as worldwide phenomenons go fifty shades has to be one of the most perplexing that i can remember i havent read the books but lets just say ive seen enough to get a feel for their overall tone so with the film come the legions of expectant fans which means cinemas can somehow justify putting on 30 screenings of the film in one day i have to say its nice to see a cinema so busy but why cant people get this excited over something like whiplash which is a genuinely phenomenal film i assume that question will go unanswered    fifty shades of grey suffers from the same problem as a number of erotic films in recent years there really isnt much to it drab affairs such as 9 songs sleeping beauty and the canyons appeared content to fall back on the use of explicit scenes as a selling point but they all forgot to convey any real drama or characters in their film this is true of fifty shades which with the best will in the world is far from enthralling the two lead actors share a chemistry which is thin anyway but it is remarkable that some of the dialogue made the cut perhaps that is more of a problem with the source material than the filmmakers but it makes for an unintentionally laughable experience at various points     then there is the sexual content over the last year and a half we have seen blue is the warmest colour stranger by the lake and nymphomaniac each compelling in their own way but importantly they each pushed the boundaries of what we expect and what can be permissible in an 18 certificate film fifty shades of grey is not only tame compared to these films it is tame even going back as far as something like in the realm of the senses 1976 it feels like a watered down version of a book which may well have been unfilmable outside of the r18 certification id imagine given the mpaas wariness of sexuality on screen that this had more to do with avoiding the nc17 certificate over in america    expectations were low and they were not exceeded fifty shades is a laboured film constructed to titillate the box office but little else

so here is my two cents for anyone who wants it  i am a reader i read books like no ones business and 9 times out of 10 the book is so much better than the movie so naturally when i saw how amazingly popular this trilogy was i had to jump into the hype  three long redundant books later i came to the conclusion that while the books had a decent story line they were not well written im pretty sure i could never hear oh my or anything about an internal goddess again without shuddering   then the movie came out promising to focus more on the story itself than the countless sex scenes i was thrilled and intrigued the suspense for the movie built for about a year and i attended a showing today with hope that it would be everything i had ever imagined for one of my favorite couples  lol  first the awkward and uncomfortable tension between the two main stars of the movie is enough to send you back to your middle school years completely cringe worthy the opening scenes while nice were not necessary to the plot of the movie at all i knew that the hollywood version of the story would probably have some additions and a few  scenes left out i felt completely shocked when some of the more romantic not sex scenes were completely cut out of existence leaving me with a story about a cold egotistical sadist who wants to control a poor innocent college graduate while there were times when i was drawn in most scenes were ended about as quickly as they began  dont even get me started on the sex scenes of which there were plenty while the book keeps all the scenes quite awfully repetitive the movie changed it a tad but again the awkwardness between the two main characters in more scenes than others was dreadfully distracting   all in all the first thirty minutes or so stuck to the book well enough to at least keep me entertained if you didnt read the book series maybe you can enjoy the plot line as done by the movie if you did read and mostly enjoy the book series dont even waste your money christian and ana are probably better in writing than on the big screen

dakota johnson almost saves 50 shades of grey with a star making performance alas the movie is tame dull and scared and johnsons co star jamie dornan is out shined by his better co star a major plot hole would stop this timid movie in 30 minutes johnson spins her cheesy lines into gold while dornan cant do the same this movie is too afraid to tackle its real problem christian greys low self esteem issues
