going into the cinema to see fifty shades of grey i have to admit i was excited after seeing so much hype surrounding it and the reaction from the fans at the new york fan screening i couldnt wait to see if this would be one of the films of the year and i have to say i think it definitely will be     adapted from one of the biggest selling books of all time by el james sam taylorjohnson introduces us to the world of fifty shades of grey in a romantic sexual manner that has a hidden comedic side which makes it appealing for all this valentines day     the film follows anastasia steele a young english literature student who falls for the charms of mr christian grey after interviewing him for her friend however with his good looks and brooding charms ana soon learns that he has a dominating side which he wants to explore with her in his red room embarking on a bdsm relationship the pair have many sexy moments together that are tested right up until the end     from the moment it started right up until the end the film follows the plot of the book almost completely the same which made me very happy as someone who had read them while i did find some of the book quotes to be used too much there was a need for certain ones to fit certain scenes and i can see why they had to be used     as for the steamy moments they are wellvery steamy while some critics said they were a bit tame they certainly are not there is a lot of action on screen and in my cinema we found ourselves laughing not because they were bad but at the realisation that we were watching such hot moments together the cast and crew have made tasteful sexual scenes that give off a lot of heat and will not disappoint fans of the book who are going to see how they have made the move from the pages of the book you may have an image in your head of the red room but forget it because it is completely not what you expect     people who havent read the book will be surprised by a lot of elements of the film as was the person who i went with was but they will be able to see the different ways in which the characters feel at times and how their power or presence is meant to come across it starts with a very innocent ana however by the end of the film the power is back in her court and that is due to the excellent casting choices     while some people have been worried about the way in which ana would be presented of screen i think that dakota johnson was an amazing choice not knowing much about her acting style beforehand after only catching her in the social network and ben and kate i wasnt sure if she would fit the role however she proved me wrong and i am now a huge fan of hers her acting talents are so perfect for this role and she gives ana life in the film that people will be happy to see     and as for jamie dornan he is mr christian grey he manages to get the brooding character just right and when you see him break down the walls of mr grey you can see his acting abilities shine through the casting of him was incredible and his whole likeness to the character is great anyone who doubted him will be changing the way they feel by the end of this film for sure and will be a dornan fan straight away     the other supporting characters all have a certain charm about them and make the characters come to life for me the most impressive performances came from eloise mumford who plays anas flatmate kate who is so much more likable in the films then the book i wasnt her biggest fan when i read them but by the end of this film i supported her a lot and joining her was luke grimes who plays christians brother elliot who gave the film a fun character and marcia gay harden who is the perfect mother figure each one has something about them that brings the whole film together and makes a tight knit group of stars that bounce off each others abilities     for me however the true star of the film was the director sam taylorjohnson has done an incredible job at keeping the film true to the book and while i have heard there is something that she wanted to change but couldnt i think she has done a very good job fans that are looking to see their favourite moments on screen will and the world of these characters has been captured in an immense world that will draw in the audience from start to finish     she has also provided an amazing soundtrack to the film starting with annie lennoxs amazing voice singing i put a spell on you to the wellknown beyoncÃ© songs each has its place and each one fits it i always notice the soundtrack to a film and while i had heard a few pieces from this films one beforehand it was so much better hearing them on the big screen especially the vaults song     the only thing i felt was a bit troubling was the ending however as someone who had read the book i knew it was coming i was just a little shocked at the way in which it ended so suddenly but the more i think of it i am happy it did end there instead of dragging out a moment that didnt need to happen although it would have been nice to have seen the toy plane scene in this film because i think that is an element from the book that sticks with the fans a lot of the time     overall i found the film to be an enjoyable valentines day treat and while it does have some small faults it will draw you in and make you smile at moments or feel a little upset for the characters each actor knew what they were doing and i think that this film will do amazing things for johnsons career in the future because she has given the performance of a lifetime in this role and people will be able to see it from the mood of each scene to the perfectly placed songs there is nothing this film is really lacking so i would definitely go and have a watch as soon as possible lovelies because i dont seem this franchise going anywhere soon

the movie was good definitely not hard to improve upon the books given they were so poorly written but i definitely didnt have high expectations given the criticism of the actors before it was released i was pleasantly surprised by both leads particularly dakota johnson who was absolutely perfect she brought everything needed for anastasia and even more  especially humor jamie doran came off creepy which works considering his character is well creepy however you see a nice transformation in him over the course of the movie that nicely matches the affect ana is having on him emotionally  i also didnt see any lack of chemistry between the actors as has been rumored    in the end the movie was funnier warmer and better acted than i expected and with far less of the mature subject matter that drove the book it had a story that come through beyond all that one to which a lot of the criticism out there doesnt really stand up take away the hype over the sexual theme and its not a story at all about a woman physically and emotionally submitting to a man but one about how the true need want giving and power of unconditional love can overcome someones belief that they dont actually deserve it one of my high school religion teachers fr orth who liked to find biblical meanings in popular culture music would probably find one in 50 shades of grey    and it had one of the greatest endings of a movie ever that surprised even those who read the books the collective gasp among those in the theater attested to it

everything that was right and wrong about the movie fifty shades of grey    okay i know everyone has been hearing about this movie and a bunch of you curious souls have already gone to seen it if you havent seen it yet and just want the bottom line here it is go see it its really not that bad    the first thing that was refreshing to see was that they pretty much followed the book exactly there wasnt any of that feeling of oh whyd they change that part the book was so much better unfortunately that also means that a few of the impossibly corny lines from the book anastasia its just the way i am also made it into the movie and made for some pretty terrible moments that said they did find a clever way to show you the email and instant messaging banter which made me smile when i read the book it was good to see they found a way to keep it in there    thankfully i thought that the actors did a great job of conveying the nonverbal communication the intense eye contact and body language that goes into seduction despite having no inner monologue to listen in on the inner goddess is graciously not mentioned you really get a good feel for the tension that builds overall and other than a few forced oneliners that you could tell the actors hated they did a fantastic job of accurately portraying the characters in the book    the sex scenes were hot there i said it they really were better than anything ive seen of late and surprisingly realistic i even enjoyed watching the slow controlled way that he introduced progressively more intense activities to her dakota johnson has a smoking hot body and watching her reactions was well just go watch it    on the bdsm side of things im going to come right out and say that this is probably the best mainstream movie about bdsm thats been made so far there are some serious issues that ill get into later but overall they did a great job of explaining safe words hes very serious about getting her consent and making sure shes safe they also got into some of the nitty gritty details of a domsub contract which was interesting and mostly accurate    and thats about where the good parts end there are two main issues that i take with the story fifty shades of grey starting with    christian is portrayed as being into bdsm because of some dark deep childhood abuse or trauma that is lightly alluded to in the story he says he has to be this way and that hes fifty shades of fucked up unfortunately this gives the impression that anyone that is into bdsm must be fucked up mentally and this is their weird twisted way of dealing with their issues now this isnt to say that some people in the bdsm community do have terrible ordeals they dealt with as children but by and large most people are into bdsm because well its fun its hot its sexy its taboo and dirty and something you dont tell your parents about people like things like that and its okay on to major issue two    anna doesnt have the slightest interest in being a submissive this isnt to say that women who have never learned about submission wont develop an interest once being gently introduced to it pro tip walking an innocent young woman into your play room which looks like a fancy version of a dungeon from the spanish inquisition and then slapping down a masterslave contract in front of her is not a gentle introduction     however we learn during the story that even after playing out a few very hot scenes with christian she still doesnt really have any interest in being his submissive really she just wants a vanilla relationship with a really hot confident guy that just happens to be a billionaire and this is where the story takes its turn for the worse because now we have this character christian who has all these problems and sweet little vanilla anna whos going to fix him and turn him into a regular vanilla boyfriend    which again gives off the impression that anyone thats into bdsm is broken and needs to be fixed     the problem is compounded by the fact that anna is a completely innocent and sexually sheltered woman not to mention fairly plain looking whos now being wooed by this billionaire yes with a b playboy rides in his helicopter rides in his exotic sports cars getting a new laptop getting new car etc from a certain point of view it becomes a story about some super rich guy seducing and taking advantage of a hopeless young country girl and lets face it    christian is a total psycho control freak and this is the message that i especially want all women who are curious about domination and submission to hear steer clear of anyone you meet that does things like christian grey showing up where you work uninvited creepy tracking your cell phones location and then showing up there creepy stripping you naked and putting you to bed while youre unconscious creepy giving you death ray eyes because you look or talk to another male creepy okay real dominants the good ones that are doing this for fun and excitement and mutual enjoyment dont need to coerce or convince or bribe women to submit to them curious women want to do it they might even beg for it    the final scene and the final nail in the coffin involves christian pushing anna way beyond her limits something a real dom would never do interestingly the vibe given off by both of them when entering that final scene felt very accurate meaning it was all wrong regardless of what requests got made a good dom would have put a stop to that right then and there and sometimes he has to make that call and then of course we have the abrupt ending which leaves everyone sitting there like what just happened remember this is book one of three the story is supposed to continue    my final word on the movie is that its a sexy ride that you should go on but be aware of the differences between reality and fiction      what you should do if youre curious about exploring sexual submission    first do your research there are lot of good resources online talk to other submissives and dominants and ask questions take your time dont jump into anything and make sure that the dominant is going at your pace not theirs look for certain cues for example the dominant should be asking you a lot of questions early on questions about your limits your desires fantasies curiosities if all they talk about is what they want to do or if they keep steering you towards a certain fantasy or activity even though its not something you are interested in just walk away a good dom takes time to find and there are plenty of guys out there that hide their abusive tendencies by claiming to be a dom watch for the signs    while its reasonable when youre in a relationship with someone that they ask you stay sexually exclusive with them banning you from friendships with other guys or getting angry if you talk to or look at another guy is a big warning sign you want a dom to help you fulfill your fantasies not an insecure boyfriend whos going to fly into a jealous rage if another male comes up a good dom knows his value he doesnt fret when he cant keep an eye on his submissive if she wants to go thats what she should do    while most dominants will impose certain rules as a condition of the relationship the rules should be reasonable and most of all they should be fun for example telling you to wear a skirt and no panties to work is a fun sexy enjoyable rule you get to spend the day knowing youre doing something that pleases your dom and it makes you feel like a dirty little slut while youre doing it thats great thats what were doing and its completely okay making a rule that you have to text him twice an hour telling him where you are because he doesnt trust you is not a fun sexy enjoyable rule we have a name for that and that name is psycho control freak dont confuse men who are dominant with men who are abusive    your potential dominant should be very interested in your life and encourage uplift mentor and inspire you he should make you feel good about yourself sexy and beautiful and desirable he should treat your submission as a gift a precious gift that youve given of your own free will and desire one that you have the right to take away at any time a gift he has earned and you trust him with this isnt to say that you may have dark or even extreme desires that you want to explore but at the end of the day being a dom is about helping a sub safely discover the deeper levels of her sexuality if hes only concerned about what he wants or makes you feel bad about yourself walk away    a bad dominant can really hurt you and really mess up your life but a good dom can give you everything you ever dreamed of he can help you let go and discover heights of pleasure and erotic pain you never imagined possible choose carefully

filthy shame of greys lack thereof or the unintended virtue of audience  by rob feight    when the girl twentysomethings were buzzing about a book titled as though it was intended to assist passionate monochromatic painters with technique i hardly took notice a couple of months afterwards when the buzz had turned into giggled whispers at housewife round tables and on the radio my curiosity peeked open nary an eyelid    three years a movie and a cringe worthy mountain of negative reviews later and now hopefully just maybe this fraudulent lecherous abduction of the classically beloved story of cinderella will extinguish itself though from the droves of moviegoers that have seemingly been going to bed unfulfilled that fire may already be gonewith much the same speed in which a shallow lustfully founded relationship fizzles    the sooner the significant others of hard working average guys can cease daydreaming about this fallacy the better

i have seen some pretty bad movies in my day i will watch just about anything and every horrible movie i have seen has at least one redeeming quality that makes it watchable  fifty shades is that rare movie that had nothing at all in it that was even remotely good  we all know this movie will makes millions just because of the success of the book and i feel bad for every other movie out there that is so much better but not a big money earner  first off when you are making a hyper sexualized film you have to cast attractive leads that will appeal to everyone  they failed on both parts as dakota johnson is just an average looking female and jamie dornan looked like he worked out in the gym for a week before having to have his shirt off in every scene  the dialogue was weak and clique the acting was below average however dakota was the best and the storyline went nowhere  every movie needs to lead up to something reach a high point and have conflict and arrive at an ending but 50 shades thought they could do without any of that  now dont get me wrong i am a sucker for a good love story but you actually have to create a relationship and show affection between two people to make it believable and none of that was present in this one  i am sure most people are going into this thinking that the best part will be the sex scenes and they turn out to highly underwhelming  they seemed to forced and nothing was natural and it was like the directors tried to hard to make it intense and over the top but it fell flat  i could go on but i think my point has been made and dont even get me started on the ending horrific  see it if you read the book and have to watch it come to life on film but trust me any other movie out in the last 5 years is better then this piece of junk sorry 50 shades fanatics its true

its hard to be ignorant of the publishing phenomenon that is 50 shades of grey by el james the erotic trilogy became notorious for its numerous and often outrageous sex scenes i have many female friends and relatives who read the series and while not a one will admit to finding the series ostensibly good they each read every book in a way it reminds me of another popular yet critically maligned romantic series  twilight it should be no coincidence then that grey began its early life as twilight fan fiction the movie adaptation was a hotly followed topic after all people argued how could it possibly be rated r how could you adapt it to the screen with a female director sam taylorjohnson wife to actor aaron taylorjohnson and a female screenwriter kelly marcel to steer the adaptation process i figured i would at least get a sense of exactly what was so uncontrollably appealing about the series for a film designed to be titillating and provocative i came away wishing it had more action of any sort because the movie was just so freaking boring    anna dakota johnson subs for her sick roommate and gets to interview playboy billionaire christian grey jamie dornan he takes an interest in her innocence and so he runs into her at the hardware store where she works he fetches her after a drunken text on her part and whisks her away to his luxurious seattle highrise before things can get frisky he has to share a secret hes a dominant looking the world over for women who are willing to submit to him and be his submissive the world of sadomasochism is a new one for anna a 22yearold on the verge of graduating college however shes drawn to christian and accepts his terms and thats when the sex gets taken to another level    so much of the film is the drawn out flirtation between two characters that i found painfully uninteresting wasnt this supposed to be the exciting and sexy story of risquÃ© sex and overpowering urges im by no means the target demographic but i felt unmoved by the onscreen sex because it was so sedate by hollywood standards ive seen more enthusiastic and engaging sex scenes skimming the channels of latenight cable tv it certainly doesnt even come close to rivaling some of the steamier sequences of films past like 9  12 weeks the dreamers henry  june last tango in paris the piano risky business sex and lucia dont look now y tu mama tambien dangerous liaisons sex lies and videotape little children mullholland drive and secretary for fans of romance with bdsm please give 2002s secretary a chance since it is 500 shades superior to el james    i understand that most erotic tv series and films are readily designed for men and 50 shades was designed for women and there are differences in approach and stimulation but for a product that is famous for the degree of kink involved i was sorely disappointed by the results in short the movie needs more kink it plays out as an introductory guide to bondage and sm this aspect isnt even explored until the very end its too timid to really give in to the thrills of its premise and likewise the demand of its readership theres a lot of nudity mostly from johnson but the sex scenes themselves are rather ordinary and sedate all things considered there are four of them in total for those curious readers wishing to keep track i also tried keeping track of the times anna bit her lower lip but lost count the sex scenes are filled with plenty of moaning but not a one of them builds up to climax a strange omission since were tracking annas pleasures i wasnt expecting the graphic and graphically drawn out onscreen sex of blue is the warmest color but i was certainly expecting more after all the hubbub in the end a sexy movie is going to be known for its sexy scenes which may or may not include sex i feel like fans are going to be justifiably irked by the absence of fullfrontal male nudity  come on give the fans a bone here 50 shades of grey is ironically far too tepid to register as much more than subsoft core eroticism    then there are the characters both of which are too onedimensional and also boring to bring much interest cinema has always been interested in goodlooking people getting it on but unless theres careful attention to plot and character then youre just recycling the same soft core setups it is wholly transparent that james novel began as twilight fan fiction because the couple occupies the same unhealthy relationship roles the female lead is a standin for the audiencereaders shes a mousey shy normal girl who gets swept away by a brooding and dangerous man who tells her hes no good insists she should not be with him but cannot help himself falling for her because he sees her inner beauty hes more male chauvinist than complex character and his obsession is less a sign of a tortured psyche and more as displayed a clear indication of a sexual predator anybody who requires his paramours to sign legal documents about what he can put inside them seems like somebody not worth knowing he tracks her down across the country when she dares to see her mother because anna didnt ask his permission control freak or a budding sociopath with a lack of tawdry sex scenes the far majority of the film is anna and christian ramping up their almost endless sexual tension which the movie will hit you over the head with i didnt feel a single thing between the two of them partly because of how poorly written they are and also because of the lack of chemistry we watch her bite her lip a thousand times we watch her stammer we watch him stare rather intently like a shark the filmmakers are doing the work for us rather than allowing a romance to blossom organically its cajoled and manipulated and feels inauthentic in every sense even before the trip to the playroom begins     there is one standout scene that is actually sexy and apparently its quite different from the source material as anna and christian go over his legal language for his submissive they treat it as a business meeting with an arch sense of professionalism its one of the few times anna displays a spark of personality as well as decisionmaking as she goes line by line and says what she will and will not do its played with a wry sense of humor but theres also a sexy undercurrent throughout the scene where these two adults are having fun with the preliminaries if the rest of 50 shades of grey had this same sense of personality and fun it might have worked as an engrossing erotic fantasy     johnson need for speed is an enjoyable screen presence even if theres absolutely nothing interesting about her character anna is so absent a personality that it makes it easier for the story to present someone else doing all the work for her pushing her prodding her giving her form johnson plays a lot of scenes for laughs which work in a tittergenerating way i kept hearing patricia arquettes voice whenever she spoke but i may be alone in this unusual observation dornan tvs the fall on the other hand is terribly wooden again hes playing a rather terrible character with rather terrible dialogue but its hard to feel any authentic sense of passion from the guy its hard to say whether these actors are miscast or whether there could ever possibly be a suitable matching because of how lacking the simplistic characters are theyre archetypes and ones the movie has to keep persuading you are totally hot for one another     so what is it that makes this property the wouldbe blockbuster that it is the story arc has been done before for decades going all the way back to rudolph valentinos son of the sheik the mysterious prince who comes and sweeps the princess of her feet to his exotic world of privilege 50 shades isnt reinventing the wheel but it has struck a chord and perhaps its the wish fulfillment angle the introductory angle to a world of bdsm or the plain jane ordinary heroine that acts as a cipher for readership the books are the books and the movie must be judged on its own account im sure most of the series fans will be pleased one way or another though i doubt many of them will find the movie an improvement over the book then again it does strip away james wretchedly torrid writing if it wasnt for the 100 million books sold worldwide this movie wouldnt be generating any of the hype it is but is that the films fault the hype machine unfairly builds expectations that will fail to be met but then again its the oversaturated exposure that has ensured 50 shades of being a valentines weekend event for half the planet     surprisingly boring and rather tepid 50 shades of grey feels too callow to be the provocative film experience it wants to be it needs more of just about everything more characterization more organic coupling more story more romance more kink it is lacking in too many areas though the production values are sleek like its the most technically accomplished episode of red shoe diaries its a tedious story of the hazards and joys of giving up control but i didnt care about the characters i need more than pretty people staring at each other for an hour while a breathy remix of a beyonce son plays over the scene to be fair that beyonce remix is hot the actors dont connect together and the christian character comes across as more of a monotone jerk than wounded bad boy im sure 50 shades has pushed millions into exploring aspects of their own sex lives they would not have felt comfortable exploring beforehand and good for them my friend angie quipped that if nothing else the release of 50 shades of grey will cause a spike in battery sales for its opening weekend its a shame then that the movie is too limp where it counts to be serviceable     nates grade c

just finished watching fifty shades of grey and i gotta say the film was beautiful yes i am using the word beautiful to describe this movie i went into the theater completely prepared to be embarrassed because of how graphic it was supposed to be but i was extremely surprised by how i actually felt i watched all of the scenes that were made available and thought that it all seemed a bit awkward but it was only because there was no background music or noise watching the actual scenes in the movie was a whole other experience   the movie is getting a really bad rep because of the bad writing and graphic scenes that are in the book that it is based on however the movie is not just a sex movie like everyone says its pretty hilarious and romantic the sex scenes were extremely dialed down and they all served a purpose if you thought the pointless sex in the wolf of wall street was acceptable then you would be more than okay with the content in this fifty shades before i watched fifty shades of grey i watched a lot of interviews with the cast of the film and was confused as to how they could possibly describe the sex scenes as being classy and elegant but then again all i had to compare it to were scenes from game of thrones true blood the wolf of wall street etc after watching this film i can honestly say that i completely agree with the cast there was nothing dirty or wrong about what i was seeing on the screen sam taylorjohnson the director did an excellent job with this movie she made it very tasteful and easier to accept this film could have gone in a very bad direction but thank god it didnt   for those of you that think that this movie is glorifying abusive relationships think again because i think that it actually empowers women im sure that you can argue with quotes from the book that im wrong but there are many differences between the film and the book let me remind all of you that the book is a little over 500 pages and the movie is only about 2 hours long obviously they had to cut a lot of things out including the blue string scene that im sure a lot of people are aware of in my opinion they cut out many of the scenes that were considered controversial i watched the movie looking for signs of an abusive relationship but i really didnt see anything of that nature in fact all i saw was this confident and empowered woman that made all of her own decisions she was not forced to do anything that she didnt want to do she wanted to explore christians dark world and her own sexuality you can argue that christian abuses her physically and emotionally but he does what she tells him to do when she says stop he stops when she says that she wants more he tries to give her more   moving on to something lighter the comedy in this movie is on point there were many laughoutloud moments that gave the movie a lighter mood those scenes were there to show that christian and anas relationship was not all dark and serious i mean they are both young people in their twenties that should be having fun  dakota johnson gave a phenomenal performance and did everything right she was confident awkward shy and funny all at the same time jamie dornan also did an amazing job as christian grey they had great chemistry  i guess what im trying to say is that you should give the movie a chance if you hate the book it doesnt necessarily mean that you will hate the movie i have read many reviews written by skeptics saying that they ended up loving it dont let the bad reviews or even the book itself stop you from seeing the movie i was not disappointed at all with the finished product even though they cut out a few scenes that i loved it is perfect just the way it is   i apologize for any grammatical mistakes unlike ms steele i am not an english major

lets be honest here this movie never had a chance people were excited to see this movie before a single marketing frame was released for one reason to make fun of it   i guess i can see why the book its based on became a publishing phenomenon and even as people were buying themselves and their friends a copy they were lambasting it   i didnt read the book but from what i understand its poorly written actually from what i understand thats an understatement still people read it why curiosity perhaps a way to feel kinky without feeling socially unacceptable it obviously spoke to something rooted within the collective subconscious everyone has sexual quirks about them things that turn them on that they wouldnt want many other people to know im sure theres more than a few people out there for whom pain equals pleasure   or it could just be that in this social network addicted day and age where you can keep tabs on the people in your life as often and easy as looking at your phone they didnt want to feel left out if youre in a group of three and two of them have read the book and you havent thats a shitty feeling you want to be in on the joke in on the conversation     that certainly seems to be the case for the movie as well as of this writing fifty shades of grey holds a paltry 26 rating on rottentomatoes people go to see it knowing its going to be bad they pay for the movie ticket the overpriced concession snacks deal with the crowds and the sticky floors and the lack of parking to see a movie they know will be bad   even in the showing i went to the snickering started in the first scene and lasted until the last some of the that was nervous laughter immature people going to see a naughty movie and acting like a group of teenagers who just stumbled across their first porno mag giggling at the sight of bums and pulsating bodies giggling louder the steamier the scenes got grow up too bad the theatres dont enforce a mandatory maturity rating along with the age one     but people are going to see the movie in droves in many cases pretending to see it only for a laugh but in actuality seeing it for the same reason they read the book the subject matter so how does the movie handle its somewhat taboo content well considering i just referred to it as somewhat taboo perhaps not as bravely as it couldve or shouldve   again i didnt read the book if someone tells me a book sucks im not going to bother with it i dont care how many conversations that leaves me out of but i get the gist   and as far as this movie is concerned it feels a little watered down thats not to say it doesnt earn its r rating 18a in canada but it feels like when the steamy stuff just starts to get good and steamy they abruptly cut to the next scene this is probably to maintain the rating ive no doubt when the movie hits home release it will do so with an uncut version you couldnt see in theatres but still people are here to see some action   there also arent a whole lot of steamy scenes and the non steamy scenes arent interesting enough to justify that     a lot has been made of the lack of chemistry between the two mostly unknown lead actors in the film i dont know if its chemistry they lack more so than the ability to act i know that jaimie dornan who plays christian grey wasnt in the least bit convincing as a young billionaire control freak with a dark past and strange desires dakota johnson as anastasia isnt bad though she does well with the initially annoying but appropriate mix of innocent wide eyed wonder coupled with an addiction to this new and exciting man and the passion he sparks in her   is that to say the movie wouldnt have been hotter with two established sexy young stars in the role no it wouldve give me ryan gosling and blake lively any damn day but it is what it is man i love that saying dont you     my biggest problem with this film isnt the acting or the sexual cowardice its the ending all in all i felt that the film wasnt as bad as people were making it out to be it is an interesting story aside from a few unforgivably cheesy lines of dialogue im sure were transplanted from the book it wasnt terribly written and it has its moments of genuine humour danger and passion but it didnt go anywhere it ultimately feels unfinished it felt like it was building up to something for two hours and then the filmmakers just forgot to slap an ending on it its a sopranos style ending that makes you scratch your head when the end credits pop up unfortunately this sort of ending makes everything that came before it more or less pointless it wouldve made more sense if this movie was called fifty shades of grey part 1 and while i have no doubt there will be a sequel the feeling walking out of the theatre is not one of passions ignited or kinky itches scratched or even the aftertaste of delicious chemical coated popcorn its one of frustration of annoyance of a hard spanking the bad kind not the good kind

i was never tempted in any way whatsoever to read the book and its sequels on which this movie is based in spite of its global success originally inspired as twilight fan fiction twilight being another book series that i avoided though i did sadly watch the movies the series received mostly derisive but also guiltypleasure reviews while racking up big bucks  plus a picture deal  for its author el james it told the story of virginal college student anastasia steele who meets handsome young gazillionaire christian grey  a man with serious control and other issues and a taste for kink  and plunges into a sadomasochistic relationship in which he is the dominant and she the submissive except that plucky young ms steele doesnt quite take to the lifestyle as mr grey might want making the central conflict of the book and series the question of whether or not anastasia can change or heal christian and mold him into the man she would prefer to love rich strong and like totally into her but without the whips and chains    since i havent read the book i cannot tell you where the movie directed by sam taylorjohnson nowhere boy departs from its source material i can tell you however that based on what is on screen if this is what bdsm is all about ill take a pass as i like to think of sex as an alternately exciting romantic and intimate  or ideally all three  communion between two or more lets not judge consensual souls and what we get here is none of that instead we have two actors who look bored in each others presence going through the motions of sex and bondage with neither zest nor passion say what you will about the artistic merits of a film like nine 12 weeks  an obvious comparison  but the characters played by mickey rourke and kim basinger seemed at a minimum to enjoy being in each others presence unfortunately for ms jamess fan base there is no chemistry whatsoever between the heretofore littleknown dakota johnson need for speed  daughter of don johnson and melanie griffith  and her costar jamie dornan flying home    at least ms johnson is fun to watch much to my surprise shes got moxie based on my reaction to the nauseating trailer i expected to not only loathe the film but both actors as well instead i found myself thoroughly won over by the young female lead until the tedium of the script and listless sex scenes take over the movie ms johnson livens up every scene she is in which is most with her winsome spirit and energy its not her fault that the source text requires her to bite her lip like a schoolgirl and she makes the most of what opportunities there are to rise above the material the same cannot be said for mr dornan an actor with the screen presence of daysold meatloaf this is a man who at 27 has somehow managed to amass a huge fortune and create a vast empire i dont think so granted his is a thankless task he has to somehow incarnate a man who has to be strong sexy dominant yet also somehow vulnerable im sure that greater actors than mr dornan would fail as well and yet it would have been nice to see him actually try can you imagine mickey rourke wining after the fact about how he hates seeing his bum on screen hey nobody forced you to make this awful movie dude could you not even try to match dakota johnsons effort    leaving aside the politics of whether we need in 2015 yet another cinderella fantasy of the poor girl offered a life of pleasure and leisure by a fantastically rich man or whether or not a film about a dominantsubmissive relationship is appropriate for valentines day  all besides the point for those who just want a naughty escapist movie to watch  the greatest sin of this movie is that it is just so absolutely dreadfully boring im 50 shades of fed up utters the tortured mr grey if only he really were then we might have something interesting on our hands    heres a suggestion for you if youre into what the story promises yet fails to deliver stay in and rent last years venus in fur this weekend instead youll have a better  and sexier  time

the movie was phenomenal the character dynamic was just insanity the good kind both anastasia and christian were such round characters there were distinct change between both of them as the entire movie went on anastasia explores her sexuality as well as learns to stand up for herself with christian and stand up for herself in life christian learns how to open up and finally express his emotional past with another person the funny thing is if you watch the movie all this stupid controversy   over people complaining about women being degraded and abused its simply not true there is obvious consent given for christian to perform any act of what would have been totally considered inappropriate without it they dont even say that being submissive is only for females they made it clear that males can be and can enjoy being a submissive themselves the story was phenomenal the second you detach the possible uncomfortable feeling one might have in not seeing the common traditional appeals to sex and pay closer attention to what is actually the underlying reasoning for the more severe aspects of the relationship it becomes a truly beautiful story i think it was amazing and cannot wait for the second one assuming taylor will be directing and james will have less of a force on the film

el jamess erotic novel fifty shades of grey is one of those books that virtually everyone has heard about  it started off as a twilight fanfiction  talking about the book in public probably makes you feel pretty dirty  it spawned two sequels  and bdsm bondage and discipline domination and submission sadism and masochism is the key ingredient that is supposed to define the novel  the movie begins with a young virginal woman anastasia steele dakota johnson interviewing christian grey jamie dornan a young billionaire with a secret past and unique sexual interests  anas best friend was initially supposed to interview him but the plotconvenient flu prevents her from attending henceforth requiring ana to go in her place  christian seduces the young woman and introduces her to a world where pain and pleasure are intertwined and the line between romance and abuse is barely noticeable   christian informs ana that he is a dominant and that he wants her to be his submissive  he hands her a bdsm styled contract asking her to look it over sign it and surrender herself to him  throughout the film ana is forced to deal with christian as she attempts to deal with christians need for her to be a sex slave so that he can control and punish her  for the most part the film stays true to the source material which means the same controversial aspects and depravitydriven moments in the novel find their way into the picture  several moments in the book indicate that the relationship is uninformed consent at best and christians stalker tendencies unhealthy behavior and abusive habits make the character look like a predator  ultimately fifty shades of grey is a poorly made and severely flawed film that is oftentimes depressing  calling fifty shades of grey a porno would be largely inaccurate as the 2 hour film has only 15 minutes worth of sex  a porno would also have to some type of titillation or arousal factor  however the sex scenes are relatively tame and they dont come close to pushing the envelope on the r rating  neither johnson nor dornan is shown fullfrontal and the camera cuts away every time an act of penetration is about to occur or is occurring  the scenes in the red room are particularly underwhelming as the filmmakers fail to show the differentiating factors between traditional sex and the bondage that ana becomes exposed to  the sex isnt hot or kinky  its just typical rrated sex         since less than 20 of the films running time is devoted to sex scenes that means there has to be a story to support a film with a 125 minute runtime  however the story is weak and the plot is nonexistent  none of the supporting characters or side characters are given the screentime or development that is necessary for a story to work  one friend of anas after attempting to make a move on her never returns  he just disappears entirely  kate is just there to be a character prop  characters related to ana and christian just show up for the sake of showing up  the film largely focuses on ana and christians relationship but there is no genuine development and the actors lack chemistry  even in sex scenes the action feels forced and the filmmakers desire to avoid close ups of the sexual acts and the characters reactions make it even tougher to connect or care about the characters onscreen  as the film goes on it becomes painfully obvious that the majority of the films events occur for the sake of occurring and so that the existence of the sex scenes can be justified   dakota johnson is well cast  she successfully conveys anas inexperience and naivety  her character is given little to do besides being confused getting bossed around and attempting to break through christians shell  however johnson makes the most out of the role that she is given  in a picture with little energy and a bland story she provides the picture with some spark  jamie dornan on the other hand is badly miscast  he has no charm is creepy on several occasions and he fails to develop any chemistry with johnson  most of that falls on the screenplay and its source material  its really difficult to root for a guy that has no redeeming or sympathetic qualities  its even worse when the character comes off as a stalker and a guy with serious psychological issues  however dornan fails to do anything with a bland role that relegates him to being a predatorstalker cast type  those who have no knowledge of the source material will not care about christian grey    the film is directed by sam taylorjohnson and her direction is sloppy and incoherent  the music composed by danny elfman of all people fails to make an impact and the screenplay adapted by kelly marcel maintains the novels flaws and suffers from several plot contrivances  in the first five minutes the film becomes saddled with a laughable contrivance  are we really supposed to believe that the flu would keep kate an aspiring journalist from interviewing one of the most recognized people and successful billionaires in the world  are we supposed to believe that christian would fall for ana upon first sight knowing that she may not accept his lifestyle  why is he stalking her if he tells her that she should stay clear of him  and are we really supposed to believe that christian and the woman who molested him as a child could ever be friends in any capacity at all   the dialogue ranges from bad to laugh out loud awful  dornans dialogue in particular is horrendous and its difficult not to snicker or shake your head when he says that he likes to fuck hard or that he is fifty shades of fucked up  a scene where the couple discusses the contract in business fashion is awkwardly set up poorly shot and generates a lot of laughs but not in a good way       the filmmakers attempt to emphasize that what christian is doing to ana is consensual  however a good portion of his disturbing and stalkerabusive dominantdriven dialogue remains intact  furthermore anas inexperience and lack of sexual knowledge make it evident that the sexual acts and punishments inflicted upon her by christian are not entirely consensual  fifty shades of grey became popular largely due to its themes involving bdsm but the film and the series as a whole present a twisted and a highly inaccurate representation of a bdsm lifestyle  i dont know if an nc17 rating would have made this movie better or improved upon the severely flawed screenplay but it would have at least allowed the filmmakers to explore unchartered territory  fans of the novel will probably embrace this adaptation  purists may have some issues with the translation as several characters from the book are missing and various scenes have been shortened or eliminated entirely including that infamous tampon scene  however even diehards may come away feeling disappointed and shortchanged especially when it comes to the films ending    the movie retains the books ending and doesnt have a proper resolution  the movie doesnt really end or wrap up anything  it just stops  and that is what makes the experience frustrating and dissatisfying  anyone looking to watch this film as a standalone and get a satisfying resolution out of it will be highly disappointed  the film thrives on setting up events for sequels and that is among its chief missteps  that in itself is depressing    fifty shades of grey generated controversy and demands for boycotts due to its male lead being viewed as a proponent of domestic abuse and sexual violence  does this film and the series its based off of glorify abuse  i think it does  regardless of your views on this issue it is evident that this movie does an awful job representing bdsm lifestyles fails to show ana giving informed consent and embraces far too many sexual stereotypes why do people in films with unusual sexual interests or an active sex drive have to be molested andor traumatized in order to have sexual urges  anyone looking for a film to learn about bdsm or sex or healthy relationships shouldnt watch this movie  i dont know if there are any erotic novels out there that could become quality major motion pictures but fifty shades of grey is not a quality motion picture  not even close  it doesnt work as a movie as softcore porn or as an educational tool and its highly unlikely that the two inevitable sequels or if hollywood gets greedy and splits the final book into two parts will satisfy those that werent already devoted to this bizarre and oftentimes depressing series  in one scene ana asks christian to enlighten her  the character does and she learns what he is like  for audiences the cinematic experience is just as brutal and frustrating  those who are looking for a good movie or even a sexually arousing one involving romance sex andor bdsm should seek enlightenment elsewhere

fifty shades of grey toes kinky line    as this erotic fantasy story began it was immediately apparent that this movie journey would take a path much different from most within seconds of the movies start applause was heard from the excited and overwhelmingly female audience who realized that their long wait to see the film was finally over that roar of approval was quickly followed by giggles and laughter as a man yelled words of caution from the theaters back row do not try this at home and by this he meant kinky sex powerful seduction techniques and total dominance in the bedroom yes fifty shades of grey has all of those sexual qualities however it also offers more    this widely anticipated adaption of el james international bestselling fictional novel finds a 27year old seattle billionaire named christian grey jamie dornan pursuing the younger anastasia steele dakota johnson an english literature major about to graduate from college the wealthy grey who we learn had a rough start to life refuses to do affection girlfriends or romance    fifty shades of grey offers an escapism for viewers wanting to look inside others bedrooms toy boxes and sexual adventurism its kinky without being raunchy or sordid its seductive with tangibles that include hand  leg restraints blindfolds necktiesand ice cubes the strong sexual content and language that created this films massive hype only appear in appropriate scenes that are relevant to the overall storyline no gratuitous sex just dominantsubmissive foreplay and intimacy    what makes this film so interesting isnt the power and influence imparted by dornans christian grey character upon the physically weaker ana steele this movies main catalyst is miss steeles ability to go toetotoe with mr grey pushing back on his misguided mannerisms renegotiating his nondisclosure agreements all the while attempting to come to terms with her own emotional and physical limits  the banter between the costars throughout the film is abundant easy and feels natural lastly both dornan and johnson deserve credit for betterthanexpected acting performances in this bondage story    no film can ever compete with a readers vast imagination created from reading a book however most moviegoers who have read fifty shades of grey should be very satisfied with this sexual fantasy unfurled upon the big screen while it may not have been possible for the film to live up to all of its prerelease hype fifty shades of grey does give viewers what theyve come to expect explicit dominantsubmissive sex  and lots of it    grade b    patrick king is a writer for the reel brief movie blog at   you may email him at reelbriefmoviereviewsmailcom

kate what was he like    anastasia he was polite intense smart  really intimidating  fifty shades of grey is one of those movies that will end up being credited more for the hype around it than what is actually seen in the film  this is a film based on the first book in a trilogy of bestselling erotic romance novels that seemingly aspires to be placed in the same territory as something like sex lies and videotape or body heat but is far too bland in execution which seems like the presumed result of twilight fanfiction cometolife  i imagine there could be plenty to say about a potential blockbuster film based on a novel by a woman el james adapted by a woman kelly marcel directed by a woman sam taylorjohnson and featuring a female lead dakota johnson who takes charge on a man who masks his inadequacies with a certain kind of appearance and use of dominance behind closed doors but it comes more from what the viewer ultimately needs to extrapolate from the film rather having a film that more effectively conveys proper purpose in a story like this  the only caveat i can provide at this early stage is that i have not read the book but i doubt the many giggling women at my screening have read it either    read the whole review at thecodeiszeekcom

5310   fifty shades of grey might not be as bad as people wanted it to be or at least thought it would be but it sure conveys a pretty bad message and overall feeling yes it might be sexy at times but it was never arousing nor appealing but instead it gives you this sense of worry for anastasiaplayed very well by dakota johnsonbecause she clearly has no identity or self respect and so it can be somewhat dark and disturbing meanwhile christianportrayed blandly by jamie dornanis clearly a control freak that wants to use and control her but it is all extremely sugar coated that it might even seem as true romance but it is not for the most part however the movie was indeed very well directed by sam taylorjohnson based on its material and its cinematography looked very nice as well also the soundtrack of the movie was fairly good but sometimes too distracting when played in the more erotic scenes that said the movie is not as graphic as you might think in my opinion but still it has its moments of roughness moreover as i mentioned before the performances were partially good mainly from dakota johnson who gives this awkwardness and lightness to her character in a very dark movie but it is jaime dornan that clearly misses the mark and comes out as more secondary and kind of empty only depending on his looks and attractiveness overall this is surely one of those movies that people will love to hate or at least thats how i feel even though im still undecided what to really think because it has much more than just this masochistic relationship its not as simple as black or white and so thats what really challenges me to really analyze it and see what it is trying to say thus it was entertaining but not quite as shocking and it might not be the healthiest romance on film but still it has a big impact on todays society and culture so hopefully it wont influence as much but still it is something fun and out of the ordinary to experience at the movie theater by yourself and decide if you like it or not     february 12 2015

ill admit to seeing this out of curiosity as to whether the movie actually improved on the books i found the books completely unreadable and supporting a destructive abusive relationship the movie however has softened some of these  negative aspectsnot eliminated but toned down while the movie was still rather disturbing obsession stalking  some physical abuse beyond consensual sex it is far more watchable than the books are readable the actors despite their real life opinions of each other had good chemistry and manage to make the characters more interesting and less insipid or unlikable than the books i didnt go expecting a topnotch script or acting i got what i expected a steamy erotic movie geared towards some womens fantasies simply put its an adult check your brain at the door adult film

i thought it was really good  it stayed very true to the book i was extremely happy with both jaime dornan and dakota johnson for the leads  they both did very good at actually becoming the part if you will i thought the sexual parts were tastefully done  i really love the love story in 50 shades so if you havent read the books and see this movie i dont think you can capture truly the actual intent and  understanding of the characters      this isnt just a movie about sex and bdsm its about a very powerful man who has  very messed up views due to a pretty bad childhood and anastasia comes along and changes those views and his mindset little by little they learn and love each other very much through lots of trial and error as for the ending everybody is complaining about its exactly how the first book ends    jamie dornan had all the looks of 50 50 shades of fucked up  in the book el james is very descriptive as to the many sides of christian serious predictor boyish murcrial ext dornan displayed all of those characteristics in his roll these books arent exactly easy to display on screen so i was very happy with how it was done dakota johnson played her role exceptionally well i see anastasia when i look at her so for me she is anastasia again in order to understand the characters in this movie youre going to have to read the books       i loved it  it was well balanced sexy as helland tastefully done considering the content of the books      the only thing i think they could have done a better job on was some of the missing details from the book granted you cannot put everything in the book into the movie however i am curious to see how theyre going to add jack hyde in to the sequel given they never even mentioned him through the movie he is pretty substantial throughout the rest of the books  given their budget im sure they will figure something out i just hope the rest of the story stays on track to the storyline and doesnt veer off much

having not read the book i came into the film without much expectation and was pleasantly surprised this isnt as bad as most of the critics out there will lead you to believe the story takes forever to get going wasting time with subplots that will never materialize so sorry to everyone in this movie other than christian and anastasia you were truly not needed their relationship as portrayed in the film is uneven at best given the contradictory nature of christians character which arise from the way he sees himself and the way hes shown to be anastasia on the other hand while not an interesting character in any way has a lot more definition the direction from sam taylorjohnson utilizes detail quite nicely but it does prove to be a one trick pony kind of visual style as the motifs tend to get overused thereby diluting their visual impact the acting is a little stiff but some scenes are rather effective and if not for a utter lack of vision in the storytelling the film could have actually been pretty good this is another film which suffers from sequelitis as its preordained to be a trilogy so those looking for some sort of closure will find none as the film ends on a cliffhanger the sex in the film is a little more extreme than usual but nothing unimaginable and pretty tame actually this was perhaps a point of contention as a r rating was achieved and eagle eyed viewers will note the places where cuts where mandated to keep the rating everything feels half done and half explored sometimes not even half almost like the people involved didnt know where to take the story so they just kind of did it in the least objectionable way possible which as it turns out forewent all the potentially interesting things and relied too heavily on the familiar in conclusion see it to believe it and after that ruminate on how it could have been better because despite what the majority might think these books could have produced a decent film

i never wanted to read the books but i saw the movie fifty shades of grey is twilight without the religious crap sorry to say but the relationships in twilight didnt feel genuine or plausible  supernatural aspects aside  and thank goodness she doesnt wait four books to put out the film is sensual not sexual even thought there are boobs bushes and fucking in it its a bdsm love story that reeks of teenage drama and desperation but its still fun to watch what does that say about    sam taylorjohnson delivered a tasteful movie despite the dicey subject fifty shades is well shot the cinematography is beautiful and luminescent  sorry about that word  literally bringing to light bdsm practices she suggested sex without showing it to be honest she showed quite a bit but once again the movie is sensual and not arousing  at least it didnt arouse me taylorjohnson also got some pretty surprising performances out of her actors jaime dornan and dakota johnson were surprisingly very good    jamie dornan is exceedingly good in this role not that he is a bad actor but i wasnt sure he could pull it off he does though he plays mysterious and domination well and also clearly shows how christian grey loves the crack the whip dakota johnson as the young and innocent bella i mean anastasia is brilliant she probably would have been a better bella than kristen stewart  sorry but its kind of true      i hope dakota johnson had a hell of a pay day out of this movie because however tasteful it is shes naked a lot in this film    chessy dialogues and unnecessary inuendos aside fifty shades of grey is not that bad    wornoutspines

so much hype so much anticipation and yet fifty shades almost surprisingly so actually stands on its own two feet in fact as a reader of the books who found them reasonably enjoyable i admittedly loved this film adaptation johnson is truly a star transforming into anastasia and delivering such a natural and genuine performance complemented by dornan who manages to fit the elusive greys shoes theres an honesty to their chemistry created by witty dialogue and humorous banter that had me giggling constantly throughout but perhaps most importantly the sex scenes and subject matter is handled so delicately and so perfectly humour planted in the perfect spots yet avoiding any sense of comical and creating the perfect amount of sexiness i took my man along and even he claimed it wasnt as bad as he thought it was going to be and was actually alright fifty shades is sultry sexy and yet at its heart it portrays quite a sweet atypical love story

fifty shades of grey was a peasant surprise and i liked it the movie both improved on the book which ive read all 3 nearly 3 years ago yet remained faithful to it the writing was much better than the book with no use of oh my or inner goddess and excellent usage of laters baby the movie was actually intentionally funny despite its subject matter and had its intense moments particularly at the end going into it you should already know what to expect i watched it at powerplant mall here in the philippines where there were disclaimers posted at the ticket booths at the posters and at each cinema warning you about the subject matter of the movie so dont watch it and come out being offended it was definitely graphic and bordering on pornographic but there were blurs and numerous huge distracting screen blocks black spots to keep the rating at r18 all of which were actually introduced by the films producer rather than mtrcb the local ratings board prior to seeing the movie i was skeptical on the casting of dakota johnson as anastasia steele and all for jamie dornan as christian grey particuarly because of his shorllived but memorable role as the sheriff in once upon a time however after seeing the movie dakota johnson was spectacular and gave a bold and authentic performance while jamie dornan fell a bit flat although he certainly fulfills the aesthetic requirement of being christian grey another standout in the movie is its soundtrack with contributions from numerous artists including ellie goulding with catchy songs that fit appropriately into the mood of the movie overall fifty shades of grey certainly isnt for everyone especially those who have delicate sensibilities or moral objections but if you liked the books chances are you would most likely enjoy the movie as well

firstly i would like to point out that the myth that the book is always better than the film adaptation is correct with the exception of this miraculous work of art  during the 2 hour movie i noticed that although the story and dialogue stayed relatively the same compared to the book the interactions between christian and anastasia such as their tone of voice managed to convey a completely different message to the audience christian is portrayed as a slightly more timid person than illustrated in the book while anastasia seems bolder although these changes may have been a flaw in the actor and actress performance i believe it may have been deliberate as to show that although the books message may have been that males are dominating the female population both sexually and in the social hierarchy females can also be dominant in relationships along with the facial expressions this film expresses the idea of humans insatiable lustgreed and temptation when it is at their own peril   additionally the scenes including the much anticipated sex could be translated as a metaphor for humanitys greed and blindness in the site of their own desires      overall the film was able to consider several unseen themes in the book and was able to give the audience a refreshing perspective of what this controversial novel is about    congratulations are in need for jamie dornan and dakota johnson who were portrayed as christian grey and anastasia steele respectively due to their superb interpretation of the books darker themes if it werent for these specific people then i wouldnt be able to be so impressed their performance was able to let the audience look past the sex scenes and concentrate and wonder what the characters were thinking in the situations they were thrown in and how they would act  highly recommended for those who find a pleasure in viewing films that explore difficult real life problems

it can be said without a doubt that if you take away all movies featuring superheroes jedis or postapocalyptic rebels the most anticipated movie of 2015 has been the adaptation of el james fifty shades of grey this book which has taken the world by storm and titillated more middleaged women than a young brad pitt has generated so much interest on its journey to becoming a film that it is expected to break box office records all over the place this weekend    but before i move on to sharing my feelings on the films quality i should probably come clean on how im approaching it i have never read the book i have no intention of ever reading the book in fact all i really knew about the plot going into it was that it was about a ridiculously handsome man who happens to be into all sorts of kinky sex as a result my reaction here is about the film and only the film those of you looking for comparisons to the book will have to look elsewhere    leading me into the movie of course was the protagonist with the discarded bond girl name of anastasia steele played by dakota johnson and although johnson doesnt convincingly look like a young woman just graduating from college she actually ends up being the films strongest asset with a nice mixture of humor and compassion that make her an ideal leading lady    through johnson we experience anastasias first encounter with the mysterious christian grey played by jamie dornan when she takes her roommates place interviewing him for the college newspaper grey with his impeccable business suit and pretty boy looks makes an immediate impression on anastasia but the attraction is a surprising twoway street grey soon begins popping up in anastasias life in a notsoborderline creepy way in an attempt to woo herin his own weird kinda way    anastasia who is a virgin that works at a hardware store and still uses a flip phone is naturally swept away by christian greys lavish lifestyle but not everything is as perfect as she might hope when she learns that the dashing mr grey isnt exactly into cuddling    in fact hed rather whip her    and hes got a whole special play room for it to boot and when anastasia first enters this play room she knows that this aint no normal courtship grey has no interest in doing dinner and a movie instead he wants anastasia to sign a contract agreeing to be the submissive to his dominant in other words he wants to be able to do anything to her and what does she get out of the deal according to him me how charming    like any good hardware storeworking virgin anastasia is leery about entering mr greys kinky world but the two clearly have a strong connection and when she tries to resist it only makes him try harder and that pretty much sums up the rest of the movie anastasia tries to resist grey breaks his no romance policy to woo her and she relents enough to let him try some of his sm moves on her she then resists again and starts the process over    the repetitive nature of the story might work for those who are only there to see the increasing intensity of greys adventures in bondage but everyone else is likely to find the cat and mouse game between the two lovers dull and frustrating it eventually gets to a point where you have to question the judgement of anastasia who keeps running back to a man who clearly has little interest in ever putting her desires over his own and repeatedly shows up whenever and wherever he wants against her wishes its not cool    the film itself is competently shot and put together but what really kills it is a wretched screenplay filled with laughterinducing lines that had the audience i watched it with cackling at every turn johnson manages to navigate most of the clunky lines but poor dornan is crushed under the weight of bad writing on every page the unintentional comedy is only amplified on his part though thanks to his attempt to make every line reading ooze with sexuality which only succeeds in making him sound ridiculous 90 of the time he may look good enough to make you consider letting him beat you but that can only get him so far    the giggles induced by the film are then only enhanced by a horribly cheesy score by the usually reliable danny elfman and a selection of pop songs that will date this film in painfully record time    and so with a wonky script bad music a laughtercausing leading man and an obnoxiously repetitive storyline fifty shades of grey is almost impossible to recommend unless youre looking to poke fun at something for a couple of hours even the muchtouted sex scenes were nothing to write home about so now that its over all i can wonder is are there really four more hours of this to come

the first 40 minutes or so is like you are watchingreading twilight without the vampire aspect of course you seehear mostly christian say the same lines that edward said is not such a bad thing if you liked twilight too but you can notice the similarities a lot after that is when it starts getting better because the story and the dialogue start to take its own form basically no more twilightedwardbella at least not that obvious i read these books so long ago that i cant remember much what things from the book were missing in the movie but i think the director taylorjohnson did a good job translating the essence of the book into film the casting was good i wasnt expecting much from christians character because he is very still in the first book you basically learn pretty much nothing about him in book 1 book 2 is a whole different thing for his character anastasias character on the other hand has more layers because she is a character that actually evolves in the first book dakota did an excellent job portraying her she delivered the lines so onpoint that i think she was definitely the best part of the movie acting wise she was very funny without seeming like she was trying to be and you actually buy her acting also i gotta give props to her for having the courage to lay it all there about the sexy kinky stuff it was definitely way more subtle than what you read in the book but again i was not expecting much because its a movie and there is only so much they can show and still keep it rated r plus lets face it its not meant to be a porn movie im pretty sure there will be a special unrated bluray edition nonetheless i think with what they show was enough for the viewer to understand what christian is about overall it was a good translation from the book and bottom line even if you havent read the book this is a love story so if you like romance movies this is one too watch even if its just out of curiosity ps about the abrupt ending i understand it because thats how each of the books ended leaving the reader in this case the viewer wanting to know what happens next

hmmm  what the books did was to capture a womans imagination with erotic and passionate imagery  it teased and enticed the senses and did to a woman what only a woman can know  the films interpretation of the books that in my opinion do have too much repetition was almost written for a man  it focused way too much on anastasia her nakedness and was at times uncomfortable to watch  there was no focusing on mr grey and his ripped jeans or how he made anastasia feel  instead it was focused on what a man could get out of a woman and actually turned the book into a negative feeling with me thinking was it actually about an abusive relationship rather than a love story  dakota actually was a very good anastasia but mr grey could have been cast better  his irish accent dropped through his poor attempt at american quite regularly throughout  despite me sat there thinking i should have waited for dvd the film started well and was funny and engaging as soon and the space filling sex scenes started it all felt a little cheep and i was actually embarrassed for dakota especially thinking of her having to sit though her own premiere i think for the sake of a book and its hype she sold herself out for a role that she should have turned down  having said that they should have left the book alone and in the imaginations of the woman who read it

fifty shades of grey is a fair erotic romantic drama film it may not have a remarkable storytelling a wellwritten script or sharp direction the fan base readers of the novels may nitpick or love seeing the erotic story being adapted on the big screen it is different from being a typical romance story as the girl is introduced into the bdsm lifestyle and the guy who lives in a certain way it is going to have those clichÃ©s of the characters having that struggle as they both are changing themselves and have that urges that they cannot easily walk away from director sam taylorjohnson may have a certain feel on the movie basically an adult version of a fairy tale of an awkward virgin girl changing after her intimate moment with a billionaire businessman christian grey     the plot of the movie is directionless about a young college graduate anastasia steele dakota johnson who is offered the chance to interview a billionaire entrepreneur christian grey jamie dornan grey and anastasia begin a lifestyle of sadomasochistic relationship as she slowly changes and she tries to change him    the movie is going to have that corny dialogue of a script perhaps the novel is not even better knowing the author is trying to aim for that seductive chemistry and sexual fantasies the character like anastasia steele in the movie is so undeveloped that it makes her so dull even after she struggles with the change when her sexual fantasies are being explored fifty shades of grey is a fair film that does not have much effort into writing or an effective direction

so much better than the book       dakota johnson brought a whole new light to anastasia taking her from a boring and nowadays very typical bella swan like character to a seductive likable strong but yet weak just a fullon complicated and enjoyable character that made the cheesy lines throughout the film somewhat bearable       sn the cheesy lines are not due to the screenplay but the book in general is filled with lines that can make even the most hopeless romantic gag    what i appreciated the most was that it did not sugarcoat the emotional abuse that anastasia was indeed going through    nevertheless that very final elevator closing scene is one of the most awful things ive ever endured i understand it is supposed to end in a to be continued type of note but there should be some form of closure before the second part comes around next valentines day
