fifty shades of dull sex and wooden acting  movie review fifty shades of grey  date viewed february 18 2015  directed by sam taylorjohnson nowhere boy  screenplay by kelly marcel based on the novel by el james  starring dakota johnson jamie dornan jennifer ehle eloise mumford luke grimes  victor rasuk callum keith rennie rita ora  max martini andrew airlie dylan neal and marcia gay harden    mr grey wont see you right now he needs to find an acting coach and a better script than this dull and lifeless adaptation of fifty shades of grey how can you have erotic sex in a movie and make it boring who knew that christian grey was as grey and stonefaced as dolph lundgren you can tell from his eyeexpressions that jamie dornan was uncomfortable in the role fifty shades of grey is like the 1986 movie 9 12 weeks but with bigger buzz dull sex and wooden acting    dakota johnson the daughter of actors don johnson and melanie griffith stars as anastasia steele the 21yearold literature student from washington state university who gets the big interview with wealthy entrepreneur christian grey dornan anas roommate kate kavanagh eloise mumford was originally going to interview mr grey but she became ill so ana took her place christian is interested in her so he follows her to the hardware store where she works soon they begin a relationship that will be dull and boring and they will have hot passionate sex yes ladies and gentlemen even the sex scenes are boring     after all the bondage and sex games it turns out that christians rules are do not engage in love with him or even touch him in bed if you break one of christians rules you will be punished christian grey has the brain capacity of a silver spoon this guy doesnt care about love at all christians rules soon begin to take a toll on ana who spoiler alert leaves him and his amazing lifestyle at the end director sam taylorjohnson who is the wife of kickass actor aaron taylorjohnson is capable of making this movie fifty shades of grey has a nice setting and she has a good actress in dakota johnson but her character is badly written    i wouldve cared about this movie if it had smart writing and characters we like to know and care about but fifty shades of grey based on el james worldwide bestseller is not that movie the cast also includes jennifer ehle zero dark thirty as anas mother max martini captain phillips as christians limo driver luke grimes american sniper as christians adopted brother and oscar winner marcia gay harden as christians mother charlie hunnam was originally the first choice to play christian grey but he dropped out of the film to do the last seasons of sons of anarchy so now were stuck with this fashion model    im sure universal plans on doing the two sequels to fifty shades so get ready for more endless love and bondage because we have another hollywood franchise to deal with

i told myself id never watch this film but here i am and no i didnt pay to see it  its friday which means i have to review a bad movie fifty shades of grey is an erotic romance novel written by el james its widely known to be one of the most controversial books ever its one of the highest selling books in the world and is sadly labeled as american literature news that a film was being made was no surprise seeing as the book sales were extremely successful it has a colossal fan basemostly womenwho love the books and went to see porn together in the cinema fifty shades of grey is directed by sam taylorjohnson and stars dakota johnson jamie dorman and no one else worth mentioning     the plotif i may be so bold to call it thatis very simple a young woman named anastasia steele johnson fills in for her sick roommate by doing an interview for her she must interview christian grey dorman a successful businessman whos about as dull as a doormat they have the interview in his office ana bites her lip as he looks at her in the most creepy stare possible the two eventually end up forming a relationship she soon finds out christian is obsessed with sex and they spend the majority of the film experimenting and babbling on about an abusive sex contract     before i utterly slam this mostly horrible piece of garbage i want to praise some things first of all the best and only good performance in this film comes from dakota johnson she was very believable and likable to be quite honest she honestly gave a decent performance unfortunately she had to act next to an emotionless brick jamie dorman is a bad actor i will  not say it was the worst performance i have ever seen in a film ever thats simply not the case he was not as bad as the guy who screams oh my god in troll 2 he was however boring blank and honestly creepy    the film presents two main characters anastasia and christian are the two characters we must follow for two hours are they interesting not really no the book itself may differ from the film in this wayi doubt itbut the characters are mostly shallow they are very uninteresting for the majority of the film once again however i must applaud johnson for going full nude it takes allot to be that commited and professional obviously the novel is erotica therefore its mostly all about sex lots of sex the actual plot itself is centered on the sex i applaud any film that is daring and adventurous when it comes to being explicit however in the case of this film its all sex and zero substance     despite all the things that made me groan about this film one thing was impressive the cinematography i know im always talking about a movies camera work but this film quite honestly had beautiful camera work it was shot by seamus mcgarvey who has been the director of photography on several well known films such as we need to talk about kevin the avengers and godzilla his shots in this film are so stunning well lit and beautiful however this doesnt hide that horrible script it was written by kelly marcel who i dont wish to slam seeing as she wasnt given much to work with the horrendous vomit enducing dialogue is almost ever present its so generic it was like the sht dialogue youd hear in a porno     the final twenty to thirty minutes of this film frustrated me the most i feel this movie had an opportunity to go into the psychological reasoning behind greys obsessions he is extremely manipulative misogynistic and abusive anastasia is literally being used and abused yet she keeps coming back it emotionally scars her the film utterly refuses to inform the audience why she behaves this way it plays it off as sexy there were brief and fleeting moments where the film seemed like it would explore deeper more thought provoking psychological themes but it kept swatting them away     fifty shades of grey may not be the worst film of all time nor as horrible as i estimated it would be however it is a dull affair overall the cinematography is beautiful dakota johnson is very solid there are a couple of genuinely comedic lines and it skims the surface of some interesting psychological themes it is also boring emotionally flat poorly written and excessively annoying bdsm is also inaccurately portrayed if i had a dollar for every time johnson bit her lip id be a millionaire i found myself yelling at the screen please stop

from the moment that i saw the trailer for fifty shades of grey i knew that itd be bad i didnt know how bad it would be but i knew that it would be somewhere within the realm of bad now this movie surprisingly isnt a complete disaster it actually looks great and dakota johnson is pretty good but thats pretty much it the main problems with fifty shades of grey isnt just the dysfunctional and unhealthy relationship that it glamorizes but the fact that nothing happens in this movie its so boring at least in the twilight movies there was a larger conflict and the movie had a mythology eg the vampires vs werewolves conflict but there isnt anything else going on here other than bad dialogue and a lack of plot the first thing here is the dialogue most of which no one would ever say some of my favorite lines include i dont make love i fuck hard and whats a butt plug as well as im fifty shades of fucked up the conversations that people have here are ridiculous theres a small inkling of selfawareness here but its buried in the awful writing im sure that most of that has to do with the source material though but it doesnt change the fact that the writing here is clumsy and awkward i havent read the bookive only read a few passages of it because its hilariously awfulbut this movie does seem to make an improvement over its source material but again theres no saving this another problem is jamie dornan who has no personality whatsoever hes stilted awkward and uninteresting he has no chemistry with johnson the two of them feel like theyve been set up on a blind date the whole time with their lack of spark the movie itself is similar in that it doesnt lead to anything virtually nothing happens and the movie itself doesnt even have aahemclimax to it its just a cliffhanger of an alreadyunderdeveloped story for those who dont know fifty shades of grey was originally a twilight fanfiction and it shows the characters are just cut out from the twilight saga instead of original ideas it uses the weak female character tripe to further the plot and a really creepy relationship its not creepy because of bdsm its creepy because of christians possessiveness and sad because of anastasias inability to stand up for herself shes so weak and pathetic and the movie milks it for dramatic effect in between the boring stretches and sex scenes the movie just feels exploitative speaking of the sex scenesand how could you talk speak of themtheyre not interesting they just feel like filler with music video direction other than mentioning how theyre not responsible representations of bdsm there isnt anything to talk about here so while fifty shades of grey isnt the catastrophe that i thought that it would be its still really bad with its underdeveloped characters and bad dialogue matched with jamie dornans charismafree performance the only real saving graces are dakota johnson the cinematography and the soundtrack although the latter cant even be attributed to the movie itself and with its slow pace and lack of intrigue for two hours theres nothing that i can say actually warrants a viewing of it 3610 awful two thumbs down far below average etc

i tried to hold out hope with this film i really did i had read the fifty shades trilogy not the first book the whole fucking wretched trilogy and absolutely hated it in fact i think el james is one of the worst writers who has ever shat upon the page with her utter incompetency and complete lack of ideas or creativity it was a franchise rife with horrible dialogue uninteresting and retarded characters bland sex scenes and a whole host of other problems    that being said amid all the shitty writing there were still ideas the concept alone is rather intriguing a billionaire with a bdsm fetish and a dark past falls for a young college girl whom he pulls into his world of pleasures and secrets that concept should have made for a pretty interesting film    however to make this work the filmmakers would have had to scrap most of the source material because this is one of those rare cases where being faithful to the source material is the worst possible mistake they could make in fact letting el james have any sort of input was a horrible idea just give her the damn money for the film rights and then tell her to fuck off guess what decision the filmmakers made    it fails at being an artsy erotic film like last tango in paris in the realm of the senses lust caution shame american beauty 2046 or empire of passion it fails at being a trashy erotic film like fatal attraction basic instinct or the underrated disclosure it fails at being weird but oddly kinky film like under the skin or the 1996 david cronenberg film crash and it even fails at being so bad that its funny like showgirls passion basic instinct 2 or in the cut i enjoyed all of these films as im quite fond of artsy trashy weird and hilariously bad films but fifty shades of grey isnt remotely satisfactory in any of those categories its a great big crushing bore that isnt even sexy    what we have here is a terrible splicing of nineandahalf weeks which is quite underrated and twilight but the splicing ends up making for a worse film than it already sounds as much as i hated the first two twilight films they were still better than this its an ugly mangled car wreck of a film that is absolutely destroyed by its own source material    the story is set in the state of washington and we begin with the very boring character anastasia steele who has decided to do an interview with billionaire christian grey for her friend and roommate kate who is sick and cannot conduct the interview for their colleges newspaper    so instead of doing a phone interview for some reason ana drives all the way to seattle to grey enterprises to conduct the interview in person she is immediately greeted with all the bland decorations of the building which are comprised of whites and greys and the staff is comprised of slender women with blonde hair which creeps her out    upon entering his office she proceeds to trip and fall down and continues to bumble things by doing a bad job at asking questions and inappropriately dropping the are you gay question on him while making comments about his controlling methods    upon leaving she is strangely fascinated by this creepy unemotional man and he too is apparently smitten with a such a boring and very stupid girl she might read a lot of classic literature but thats a feeble attempt to make her seem smart ms james and he begins to pursue her even tracking her down at the hardware store where she works so he can buy ropes and cable ties    when he starts sending her gifts she becomes uncomfortable with his advances and tries to blow him off only to have him find her at a bar where he takes her back to his penthouse after she nearly gets raped by the obligatory jacoblike as in jacob from twilight if you dont know character for a friend    soon she becomes very smitten with him and she becomes further intrigued by his sexual fetishes which she decides she wants to explore so she enters a contractual agreement with him about what she can and cant do when shes in this particular dominantsubmissive relationship which includes how long she needs to sleep eating and exercising various sexual acts and a number of other things     after negotiating the terms of of the contract like omitting both anal and vaginal fisting the two dive into this world of sexual pleasures which is unfamiliar to ana as she is a virgin and her mental and physical states are challenged by both the sexual acts and christians erratic behavior she is also struggling with the fact that she wants a romantic relationship as opposed to a relationship that is purely sexual and tries desperately to get him to open up to her    soon her life becomes a whirlwind of strange sexual pleasures expensive gifts trips and emotional turmoil as she tries to unravel the mysterious christian grey    like i said the story has interesting ideas but the execution is very poor none of the characters are interesting especially the two  leads ana is one of the dullest characters ever portrayed on the screen and makes bella from twilight look like a strongwilled katharine hepburn of bette davis character by comparison i know that some people try to argue that the point of making this sort of character so devoid of traits is so the reader or viewer in this case can put themselves in the characters shoes but if im going to do that can i at least be put into the shoes of a character whose actually interesting not only is she bland but she is also quite stupid in her actions that constantly puts her in danger    i dont mind portrayals of good girls in films but this film is in desperate need of a bad girl sort of character to lighten the mood like a sharon stone sort of bad girl performance akin to her basic instinct performance if you will or she should have taken the route of the character sada abe from in the realm of the senses who was a woman consumed by the unending need to explore new heights in sexual pleasure even if it meant killing her lover or if we are to explore the good girl route she should have been more like wong chiachi from lust caution who finds herself caught in a deadly game of trying to seduce a dangerous government agent in order to assassinate him eventually    christian grey is also an extremely problematic character yes theres the whole issue of him being an abusive creepy stalker but hes also quite bland as a tormented character if i want a tormented male lead in an erotic film give me marlon brandos performance as paul in last tango in paris    in last tango in paris paul was tormented by his wifes suicide when he suddenly begins his secretive affair with the much younger jeanne as he pulls her into his world of strange provocative sexual desires go get the butter as a kind of coping mechanism for all his personal torments they dont give each other their names its just the anonymity and escape from their lives outside that apartment it was a brilliant performance and i will never forget paul because of all he went through and how his character is explored and developed by brando himself it was very personal and soulful however this sexual fantasy was not destined to last as the film explores the eventual tragic downfall and disillusionment from the fantasy in a heartbreaking finale    christian grey is simply not interesting whatsoever he feels like a cardboard cutout of a character rather than being human hes also a huge wuss of a character hell paul would probably slap the shit out of him call him a faggot and then steal ana away from him if he were in the film he is essentially nothing more than a wish fulfillment for the author in the midst of a midlife crisis when she wrote this series which is what makes him so boring and lifeless    the sexual component which is extremely essential for an erotic film is also quite bland nothing about the sex is particularly erotic and the story does a very poor job of exploring the mysterious and deemed taboo sexual practice of bdsm you learn nothing you are only bored and even a minimal reading into the subject causes you to poke holes in its portrayal of that practice    however those arent the only reasons the sexual components of the plot fail you see even in the dumber erotic films they still try to explore the emotional aspects on a deeper level the story also flops miserably in this category it never takes any real time to examine what makes the characters connect they are tethered by the authors bland sexual fantasies where almost nothing can go wrong you never see the connection you never believe the reasons and you simply never care    human sexuality while primal still comes with a lot of emotional components and psychological elements considering the premise of the story its very disheartening that it never goes beyond being a bland fantasy it should have been something much deeper and more complicated much like human nature is    however there are some bits from the novel that are thankfully omitted from the film adaptation you will not find any inner goddess bits bizarre use of british slang fewer foodcentric scenes and characters actually talk normally well as best they can with such wretched material you will not find much whispering or murmuring    unfortunately a whole lot more is needed to be removed before the story had any hope of being good it also still keeps baffling aspects like having scenes where the characters text and email each other instead of actual dialogue which is maddening and horribly boring also much like the novel you as the viewer get to read a large portion of the contract that ana receives fucking why im not entering this damn relationship plus much of what i complained about like the characters sexual aspects and overall plot structure are sadly identical to the source material    the acting is gasp horrible however i dont blame the actors for turning out such terrible performances you simply cannot make this source material work with all the stupid shit that happens and all the horrible dialogue bogging down the proceedings even if i went back in time and kidnapped my favorite actors and stuck them in this film it would still be a piece of shit    actually the only person who could have made this work is sharon stone because as roger ebert said in his review of basic instinct 2 she talks dirty better than anyone in the movies hell throw her in here doing a role similar to her role as catherine tramell in the basic instinct films id pay money to see that think about it a young billionaire with a bdsm fetish and a troubled past falls in love with a dangerous cougar with homicidal tendencies now that would have been a fun film    im sorry im distracted again if you havent noticed this film is very boring so you sometimes need to find other things to talk about anyways the poor actors blindly stumble their way awkwardly through the whole film with no chemistry or real enjoyment of the material theyre given you can tell that they really hate this material as you watch them perform dakota johnson tries to do something with her performance but jamie dornan completely checked out with his performance and had a very distinct i dont give a shit vibe surrounding him throughout the film    i can see why they would choose this sort of film its a very risque film and the sort of film that challenges actors to do things they had never done before that can end in victory or total failure then again even success is no guarantee of how it will further an actors career    i remember reading that dakota johnson wrecked her relationship with her father and grandmother actress tippi hedren of the birds fame because she agreed to star in a film with such subject matter and after this film im sure shell forever regret it regardless of her provocative interview statement i have no shame believe me youll forever have shame over this film ms johnson    this sort of film can also be a career wrecker particularly for actresses including established ones i mean look what happened to meg ryans career after in the cut for example hell the lead actresses in last tango in paris and in the realm of the senses had their careers and lives ruined by those films despite solid reception from critics and audiences so think about what sort of damage this will do to poor dakota johnsons career after its all said and done not to mention her personal life it could very well be devastating    in fact things have already gone haywire for the leads with both wishing they had not signed onto the film and jamie dornan badmouthing his costar its already a gigantic mess for the two however they shouldnt blame each other they should blame the script unfortunately they are trapped for the sequels and have no chance of escaping    as far as entertainment goes if you havent guessed already during this really long review i found this film to be tremendously boring and unsexy it falls flat as a drama because it is emotionally hollow the attempts at romance are sad and unintentionally creepy due to abuse issues the eroticism will leave you flaccid or dry and its a bad character study about two horribly boring people    overall do not see this film if you loved the book youll be happy to see that it remains quite faithful to the source material for everyone else avoid it like the plague ive already gone on in very very long detail about why i hate it so im in no mood to sum it up any more its not worth it
